description:
A little taste of the Mission, on Chestnut!
Right on the tail end of the bustling strip of Chestnut, you'll find this family-owned taqueria. Parking is tough right outside, but try a block or two north and you should find some free two-hour parking. There are also two Muni lines that come here. 

It's pretty hole-in-the-wall! Very simple and little to no decor, this simply delicious spot is a Marina staple. There is very little seating inside, three two-seaters and one table for four, so I would not come here to dine in with a group. It's definitely more of a to-go taqueria. 

At first glance, the menu looks standard, and some might even a little boring. But this taqueria has been here since I was six years old (I'm 23 now) and the menu hasn't changed *one bit*. Menu items that stand the test of time in a neighborhood with a high turnover rate are never to be doubted. The chefs are the same boys that wrapped my burrito after soccer practice. They are very generous with their portions, and their ingredients are FRESH. I don't eat carnitas so I can't speak to that, but their chicken is JUICY and beef TENDER. This is my neighborhood burrito spot and I hope they never close.
author: Navila H.

description:
So this place is what I call a little hole in the wall place which doesn't mean it's not good because it was pretty good! It's a very small place but they have a few tables inside. They do accepts credit cards so that was a plus. 

I ordered the nachos which was more then enough food for me. It had a good amount of chicken and guacamole. Two things I feel places will skimp on. What I didn't like about the nachos is the cheese sauce. It seemed like that really fake ballpark cheese. I have noticed places here don't have the white cheese dip that I am used to getting at Mexican style restaurants so maybe it's just me.
author: Alex J.

description: Good burrito spot right off of chestnut. I have heard this place has been around a while. Friendly guys behind the counter ordering and preparing your food. Great portion sizes especially for the cheap price. Only knock is the seating area was small and needed to be swept. However, behind the kitchen which you could see into was very clean.
author: Roy M.

description: Best chorizo and breakfast burritos ever..!! Everything is clean and fresh here. Great customer service. Tiny little hole in the wall on Chestnut Street in the Marina.
author: Josh G.

description: Very quick authentic Mexican food. I'd say hands down best in the marina area. Breakfast burritos are very large I recommend splitting. Their plates and burritos are my favorite for dinner. A must try!
author: Manda P.

description: While a few other Mexican spots have opened up in the area, I always end up back at Los Hermanos because of the excellent value for money. The burritos are quite large and portions are generous. The service is quick and friendly. The food is fresh and simple. My favorite item has to be the enchilada plate (their red sauce is amazing). I loved coming here on Mondays for their tamales, but it seems like they no longer make them. Regardless, whenever I have a craving for Mexican I come here.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Love their breakfast burritos... cheesy eggs, yum. Unpretentious, fast. Better food than the 2 gringo spots a few blocks away, cheaper than the other good spot nearby. The guys who work here are kind. They get the orders right every time when you order in Spanish, not always when in English, so there's that (do remember that English is the 3rd language to hit this region).
BTW - Take a hint that the Latino guys who come here get their platters, not burritos.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
I've been coming to this spot for over a decade and the food is consistently good. Come here on Monday for their tamale special. Otherwise, I would recommend their enchiladas (they have the best sauce). The burritos are tasty and sized well. They also have breakfast burritos. 

Staff is super friendly and service is fast, perfect for takeout. 

Food: 4.5/5
Value: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Overall: 4.5/5
author: Brian G.

description: I've been coming here for over 20 years. While other restaurants on Chestnut in the Marina have come and gone, Los Hermanos never disappoint. My go to is the super chicken burrito (flour tortillas, black beans, rice, all the toppings, but most important the chicken with sauce)!  I'll go out on a limb, it's the best burrito that I've ever had having lived in Tucson where there are great Mexican food there.
author: Clark C.

description: Absolutely delicious, got the quesadilla with steak and whoa , mouth drop. The guacamole is also a great choice
author: Eddy T.

description: I love their bean and cheese burritos but this guy I'm sorta talking to think it's not good but I'm seriously obsessed so I'll probably stop talking to him cuz I don't have room for that type of negativity in my life. But seriously best bean and cheese burritos in sf I have been trying so hard to find good refried beans and I can't but this place is good.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Ate a super burrito here, my friend got 2 tacos. We got carnitas for everything. Carnitas was so dry it was like eating a burrito filled with beef jerky or dried bacon.. except without much flavor. 

I later had horrible acid reflux which I almost never get so I question their ingredients quality.
author: Tor S.

description: Such a good burrito spot. I get a vegetarian burrito and it's super yummy- they use cheddar cheese here, and the refried beans are awesome. The salsa they serve in a bottle is delicious. Price is cheap, good chips. Great place to grab a quick bite then shop or go to the movies.
author: Keely A.

description:
I was in the area after work and wanted to grab a quick dinner. My coworker recommended this place to me so I wanted to give this place a try. I ordered the super nachos with no meat and a chicken super burrito. The nachos were topped with salsa, guacamole, sour cream, black beans, and a cheese sauce. The burrito was a disappointment to me. I specifically ordered a chicken burrito since I don't eat beef, but when I cut the burrito in half, it was filled with beef. So I wasn't able to try the burrito at all. 

The service in general was pretty good. They take our orders individually and make them right then and there for you. The line goes by pretty fast.

Since I loved the nachos, I think I would return again to try some of their other foods, but I definitely was disappointed by the burrito
author: Andrea G.

description: If you are a fan of Chile relleños, these are the best!! No breading or fried. They crack a fresh egg, spread it on the grill, add cheese stuffed Chile and top it with amazing fresh relleño sauce. It is off the charts and only $4.50 ala carte. The burritos are also amazing.
author: Mikey S.

description:
First off, the guys who work here are so nice.

Second, the food comes out pretty fast and it's really good. The super quesadilla is gigantic, and the nachos are bomb. A lot of my coworkers frequent the place because the food is awesome and is right down the street from us.
author: Lexi T.

description: Best Mexican food in the marina. It's sad because the marina doesn't really have a lot of AMAZING Mexican food like the mission does but this place is definitely #1. The burritos are a great size and delicious. The employees are super nice and will let you customize however you want. Wish that they were open later then it would be the perfect drunk late night snack.
author: Jenna G.

description:
First things first.. Yes!

After being let down by not ONE (Cafe golo) but TWO (Blackwood) locally closed breakfast places we stumbled upon this little Mexican restaurant. Let me tell you.. we beat the line! I ordered the omelet burrito which by the way they literally made an omelet then wrapped it in a tortilla. Freshly cracked eggs that were made to order. ''Tis was Delish and big enough to share. 

Satisfied!
And always happy to help the little local spots
author: Alissa S.

description: Their super burritos are my favorite thing about this place. The workers are very nice and makes you want to come back for more!
author: Jared D.

description: I've been coming here for years.  It's always the same 3 guys and one woman working hard 6 days a week, and they sure make a delicious super burrito.  I also like the beef taco plates with refried beans and rice.  Sometimes you just want some hearty, filling comfort food that's quick and easy (it's a tiny place so I always get take-out).  Put on some eating-pants and stay in for the night because portions are generous and too good to save some for later.
author: Kari L.

description: Living in SF means there is never a shortage of taquerias. Los Hermanos is up there for me and i think it rivals some of the other staple chains (I'm looking at you el farolito). I ordered the chicken and rice burrito and chose the chicken in sauce rather than the grilled chicken. The restaurant is pretty small so don't expect to find seats. A huge plus is they take credit cards here. I'll definitely be back. Enjoy!
author: Ken C.

description: I've been coming here for years at least 20 because the food is good.  Great enchiladas, tamales, nachos and burritos. Portions are very generous.
author: Donna P.

description:
I was really craving a burrito for lunch, so we walked into Los Hermanos Mexican Food. It was not an auspicious start. There are no restrooms for the customers, so we had to walk over to the local library and use their facilities.

It is a rather small establishment. There is only one table which can seat a group of four, right in the front window. The rest of the tables can seat just two people, and there are not very many of them. Lots of people were ordering their food to go while we were eating.

I would have seriously considered a tamale over a burrito if it were on the menu, but Los Hermanos does not serve tamales. So I ordered a chicken and rice burrito, with chips on the side.

The burrito was just okay. I think the salsa was just plopped on in a big blob. Some bites were spicy, while others were comparatively bland. The bigger problem was that the salsa seemed to be all heat and no flavor. The tortilla was rather soggy when I got to the bottom, they need to drain their ingredients (it was probably the black beans) more effectively.

The highlight of my meal was the chips. They were nice and thick, and we received an ample portion for our money. But that was not enough to offset the mediocre burrito.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description:
This place rocks!! Great food for a great price!!
The owner is the nicest man ever too - Would come here just to speak Spanish to him and support his business!! 5 stars!!
author: Rebekah S.

description:
Named after what I can only assume is one of the best Arrested Development episodes ever made, Los Hermanos isn't bad. The various meats I tried were fairly tasty and while it doesn't rate against its Mission based brethren, this is probably good enough for being on this side of the hill.

I wouldn't ever set this place as a destination, but if some for some reason you're on this side of the hill, then it's not a bad option (and cheaper than most other things in the area). Particularly if you're say a bit tipsy after leaving a bar where you watched UCLA trounce Arizona.
author: Misha T.

description: Prices look good until you see the size of what you get. It's unfortunate. "Super" nachos for almost $10 was a really sad sight-- some bland toppings sparsely spread across the small pile of chips. Extremely limited seating.
author: Jacqueline K.

description: Been coming here for years and years. If you're looking for good inexpensive burritos this is the place. Carnitas super burrito is great. Don't let the dumpy ambience fool you the food is legit. Pollo asado is also good.
author: Mathew J.

description: Simply the best, authentic Mexican food in the marina!! Fast and friendly staff. Reasonably priced menu.
author: Tawni C.

description: I have eaten here since I was a child. The food is absolutely wonderful and does not disappoint.
author: Peter D.

description:
After walking by this place so many times, I decided to come in and try it for myself. 

I ordered a Steak Quesadilla and it was delicious; not greasy at all and was pretty big. It came with a roasted hot pepper which was insanely good and very spicy.

The staff was super friendly and the restaurant itself was clean. A great spot to quickly pick up some lunch and is reasonably priced compared to other Mexican restaurants in the near by area.
author: Rania T.

description: The staff are friendly and the food is good. I'm not that big of a fan of the chile relleno here and I usually like them. I would stick to burritos or enchiladas. It is definitely good value as it is relatively cheap for the amount of food they give you.
author: Neil P.

description: Food was good ordered the burrito Special with chips and a drink , 2carne asada taco converted in 4 and 1 red enchilada
author: Lizz H.

description:
I just love their food, especially their burritos! The staff is fantastic and super, super friendly & nice. When I've learned about them (Los Hermanos) a couple of years ago, I've never looked back, in order to indulge myself with having an authentic Mexican food. As the matter of fact, I became a great friend with the guys and a high-paying-customer ever since ($$$), just because I eat there ALL the time..., just ask my girlfriend - Lynn... :-)
I'm sure I'll be going back there next week. Sometimes Lynn would ask me.., "Los Hermanos again....?!" I reply to her, "YES" :-)

"That's all I have to say about that"... ;-)
author: Victor K.

description: If you want an authentic mexican taco or burrito, this is the place to go! The pleople there are super friendly and there hot sauce is to die for! I love there salsa roja
author: Jenn A.

description:
Huge portions and friendly staff. This has become a go-to in the rotation for my friends and I. We all get Super Burritos and stuff ourselves to death.

I get the taco salad about 3x/week. So good.
author: Ben C.

description:
Well I was hungry and they gave me a burrito which certainly fixed that. But honestly I wasn't impressed. I got a steak burrito and the steak looked like ground beef. Also the tortilla was still cold. 

I went to the front to get some extra napkins and the guy there handed me some instantly without me asking, so that was good.
author: Lenny V.

description: I've been going to L.H. for years.  I've had a variety of their dishes but what stands out the most are the burritos.  Whether it's vegetarian, chicken or pork I love them all.  It's a family run restaurant & they are so efficient.  Always with genuine smiles on their faces & great service. I believe they've been around for over 25 years!  Try the rice/beans & chili relleno combo.  It's good & gets my craving for Mexican satisfied!
author: Lisa D.

description:
Not bad if you're having a craving for some Mexican. There are definitely better places around here, but in a pinch, this place works. The prices are good, the guys are fast at what they do, and the portions are huge. 
I always get a burrito or nachos (they taste almost identical if that's telling you something).... So 3 stars!
author: J C.

description:
Unfortunately the food is not tasty and the guacamole is a weird liquified substance with a bad scent. One star because the rice is decent but everything else was unfortunately very bad. 

Ordered: Green Enchiladas & Super Burrito
author: Cindy G.

description:
I love this place, it's run by a couple of brothers.  The burritos are good and the hot sauce is spicy.

Sometimes after work, I go here, grab a burrito, walk next door to the bar and have a beer there while I eat my burrito.  Such a nice way to end a stressful day at work.

Don't expect seating...they have like 3 tables, it's mainly a pickup and go local joint.
author: Edward M.

description: One of our favorite authentic Mexican restaurants in the Marina. The food is good and the service is phenomenal. You'll know it's good when you walk in for lunch and the place is filled with people.
author: Stephanie J.

description:
I've experienced a mix in quality here. A few times I had below average burritos, but one time it was amazing.

I'm not a fan of how they throw slices of cheese on the tortilla but don't bother to let it melt a little after that.

The place is a bit grungy looking. Compare that to TOMA across the street which is clean and modern.
author: Captain B.

description:
I've been coming here for years. The guys are always friendly, the prices are reasonable and the food is good. 

I have ordered a Bean, Rice, Cheese Burrito from many a Mexican restaurants; I can say without hesitation that Los Hermanos' BRC Burrito is among the best in California. 

The restaurant is small, only six tables, so be prepared to take your food to-go. The location, the price, and the quality is hard to beat.
author: David G.

description: Great little place ...kind of a hidden gem! They make it fresh right on the spot! It's great food for little price! They guys are very nice also. Highly recommend it!
author: Darren C.

description:
These guys are always smiling, happy and friendly. Love their buena onda. 

Great burritos! I haven't even tried anything else because I stick to a veggie burrito with a little hot sauce and I'm hooked. I can't eat the whole thing though so it usually turns into lunch for two days. 

Great price and excellent quality!
author: Jaclyn K.

description:
The food was good overall here is my take on this place 

Pros:
-food is tasty
-not to pricy
-good customer service 


Cons
-no public bathroom (so you can't really was your hands)
-paper plates (my plate was soaked because I got enchiladas) 
-not enough places to sit at
 

3 stars for the food n service.
author: Scarlett F.

description:
Forget the mission you go to the marina for authentic Latin food 
Now I will advise I'm mixed & my CUBAN side has to come here get my fix 
shhhhhh  ok Ive kept my Los Hermanos addiction secret long enough I know I'll get slack for my Cuban culo going here & not a Cuban restaurant but it's not my fault it's Los Hermanos fault good food addictive hot sauce I sit dipping my fingers in it 

I have gone here since I was a baby for me it's not the $$ or how fancy the place looks it's the taste without a doubt Los Hermanos has that down packed 
with the same guy running the place a smile on his face 
the service down to earth & kind which now a days is hard to find

Ok ok let's get to the food 
yummmmmmmmm & portion is ridiculous
Usually you go into a place and it's all tortilla here its arroz (rice) fluffy the frijoles (beans) don't have that chalky taste the pollo (chicken) tender the generous portions of the salsa, guacamole, sour cream they pack it in their making sure your getting more than what you pay for
The most important ........ The HOT SAUCE can't get enough of I drench my food in it I get extra to take home 
& yes if your wondering I have tried everything on the menu From the super nachos to the burritos, quesadillas, enchiladas, chile relleno .... 

now that you've read the review go get your taste buds & stomach some 
LOS HERMANOS
author: Jay J.

description:
Los Hermanos is a diamond in the rough.  You might pass by this narrow modest looking establishment en route to more "trendier" lunch spots on Chestnut Street.  This is unfortunate because Los Hermanos is my favorite go-to quick lunch/dinner spot on a street that has many options.

I always order a "burrito bowl".  It's somewhat custom.  I essentially ask for a tortilla-less super burrito (sour cream + guac) put into a to-go container.  I appreciate their flexibility in this regard.  

I've tried different meats in my burrito bowl creation, and they're all good.  I like that there are two different chicken options:  grilled and in-sauce.  I tend to cycle through meats, selecting a different one each time I visit.  That said, if you were to plot my meat choices on the x-axis of a histogram, the results would show that grilled chicken would appear most frequently.  With such compelling empirical evidence, one can conclude that grilled chicken is my favorite burrito bowl meat.

Being a fan of spicy food, I ask for their pickled peppers/onions/carrots mixture, which I believe is called Escabeche (not 100% sure, however, as I just point to it and say "Yes Please!").  They also have a hot sauce that further enhances spiciness/flavor.

The staff is super friendly.  Two of them have an uncanny resemblance to one another.  I haven't asked them, but I'm guessing it has something to do with their namesake...I see what you did there!

Boom:  5-Stars
author: Sebastian N.

description: Good sized burritos, yet missing some authenticity. Nachos use cheese sauce...
author: Adam L.

description:
Love it! Good food, fast and friendly service. Been coming here for years and will continue to enjoy it for years to come!

Be advised - it's definitely more of a takeout place than a sit-down restaurant.
author: Justin P.

description: Los Hermanos is a small place on the busy street of Chestnut. We stopped by after a day of walking up and down San Francisco and were very happy with what we had. I have celiac disease and had no worries about having 2 chicken tacos along with salad, rice and beans. It was about $10 bucks but kept me very, very full. My boyfriend had a super chicken quesadilla which was seriously huge for about $8. Quick, affordable, gluten free friendly and delicious.
author: Rosa E.

description: Customer service was friendly and quick. And this place is clean behind the counter. That's good!
author: Pickle R.

description: This joint has been around for decades.  The owner has been around the neighborhood for forty years.  At first glance it doesn't come off as a quality place, but don't let the simple decor throw you.  Chicken burritos are still the best!  Enchiladas are classic style.  Certainly the go to Mexican place in the area.
author: Calvin J.

description:
NASTY NOT AUTHENTIC AT ALL. ill give you a few reasons why this place sucks and how you know its not real mexican food.

1. they put white rice in you burrito....
2. they offered me black beans...

by this point i was a little scared because that just tells me that its gonna suck but i kept going.

3. THEY PUT CHEESE INTO MY BURRITO!!!
4. THE MEAT SUCKS ASS!!! its not even juicy it looks like some leftovers that they brought from a BBQ they had a day earlier.

5. the burrito was 7 bucks thats pretty expensive.
6. the rice taste like crap and old!

i was going to give them 2 stars because they did have some good salsa but 1 hour later when i got home i blew fire out my ass

so this place will give you the shits! PASS
author: Jaime D.

description: I would give a five star but I try to serve that for the best of the best. This is a high four star. Why? Friendly service, great portions, and nice fresh ingredients. You literally can't go wrong with anything on the menu, though I usually stick to the burrito. Their breakfast burrito is also underrated and can feed two people (assuming you aren't starving). Great for take out or to sit down and watching the passersby on Chestnut. The nachos are also a great quick option if you're next door at Horseshoe having drinks and need some food.
author: Robbie K.

description: This is a GREAT neighborhood burrito and taco place.  Nothing fancy, but fresh, inexpensive and fast. Beats Tacolicious hands down any time.Must admit, we usually get take-out, so the way the place looks is never an issue.  Also, everyone who works there is friendly.
author: Portia U.

description:
Twas a busy Saturday on Chestnut Street in Mid-October.  Yuppies and 20 somethings were frolicking around, and the street was busy and deep in college football mode. Tacolicious was super busy and my friend and I were starving.  We love great food but at the same time we can compromise our standards from time to time, and we did just that- sacrificing quality for instant gratification at Los Hermanos.  In my 37 years of life, I had never made it to Los Hermanos, and I've eaten plenty of sketchy things before, so we took the plunge. Well, after today's meal, I am confident that I wont make it back barring nuclear fall-out.

I'm confident that this is the best burrito spot on the commercial strip of Chestnut Street, but this is also the only one to my knowledge.  My carnitas burrito was whipped up in seconds, but completely and unacceptably cold on the interior (I ate it in the restaurant just 2 minutes later) and the ingredients simply tasted like they were sitting around.  This may be good had I stumbled out of a bar drunk in the middle of the night, but really it sucked completely sober at 1pm.  I really wished I had chosen any of the other great options on Chestnut or had simply waited 20+ minutes for a seat at Tacolicious. In a city with so many great burrito places, you can do so much better (Papalote, La Canasta, El Faro, Gordo's and just about anywhere else).
author: Andy S.

description: Ordered super spinach quesadilla. Too much cheese. Weird kind of cheese. Little chicken. Good guacamole
author: PreciousSwt P.

description:
I got 14 burritos from this place for myself and coworkers working an expo over the weekend. Seriously, one of the best veggie burritos I've had in a while!! I'm getting hungry just thinking about it (too bad i don't live in SF!). Everyone loved the food and wanted to know where I got it from!! Till next time. :-)

Oh and I ordered Super Veggie Burritos and Super Chicken Burritos with everything.
author: Monika G.

description:
I was told I would be very disappointed by the mexican food in SF (being from LA), but I apparently was lied too. This place served my needs. The popular taco bar across the street, Tacolicious, was packed with a long wait, so we came here instead. 

They were closing up but let us place some last minute orders. Chicken, cheese, guac, sour cream quesadilla was just what I needed to prepare for a long night of debauchery. It was decently sized and packed with everything in decent ratio. This place won't win any awards in my book, but for cheap(er) quality mexican food will not disappoint.
author: Nick W.

description: Cheapest place I can find food in the marina. The food tastes ok, service ok, nothing to complain about.
author: Karla S.

description:
What I admire most about Los Hermanos is that they're still here! After all, this is the Marina where high rents and narcissistic consumerism often drive out small funky businesses such as this. My first visit was back in the late 1980s when Mary Anne P. and I were courting over an overstuffed burrito. We're still friends.

...Times are changing and the poor get fat, but the nachos gonna catch you when the bitch gets back...

And so it happened recently. The food is decent and generous, the prices are good, and the service is fast and friendly. Same as it ever was!
author: Eric B.

description: Their super quesadilla is delicious, comes with sour cream and guacamole . This is the best place for Mexican food at a great price considering their location..
author: douglas h.

description: I was certain that this well-located burrito shop would be at least a little bit delicious. I was wrong. Or too sober to appreciate it. I currently live in Washington DC, where there is a dearth of good, greasy Mexican. Any burrito joint in SF would be better -- or so I thought. This was so below average. I had a carnitas super burrito -- the meat was weirdly dry and the whole thing was super salty. My brother had carne asada quesadillas....and the 'carne asada' was more like ground beef. Without Mexican seasoning! We'll get to Tacolicious (across the street) earlier next time, so that we don't have such a disappointing Mexican experience.
author: Kate B.

description:
The four stars are solely because this place is right by where I work and it's basically the best cheap meal I've found in the vicinity. Los Hermanos seems to be catered a bit more towards blander tastes than the average SF taqueria, probably due to the Marina location. However, you can make a pretty good burrito with a few tweaks.

First of all, the default cheese used is some sort of orange-y cheddar (?) so you have to ask for the white cheese. This will make a big difference. Secondly, the super burrito doesn't include cilantro, so be sure to ask for it. Thirdly, since their hot sauce isn't too spicy, if you want heat be sure to ask for jalapeños (which are mixed with onions and carrots). You can also get more hot sauce on the side.

I'm never disappointed by the burritos I get at Los Hermanos (usually veggie or shrimp), but overall I probably wouldn't come here it wasn't so convenient. I've also tried some carne asada tacos, which were not good. The meat was really finely chopped and wasn't juicy at all; it was almost like a ground beef taco. They were wayyyy too dry. Los Hermanos lacks a salsa bar, or any salsa besides pico de gallo, which can be worked around for a burrito but not so much a taco. They also only have green onions, which I find odd. 

Lastly, the service at Los Hermanos is great. The same two guys are always working (I'm assuming these are los hermanos) and they're consistently friendly and patient/accommodating with your requests while they're making your burrito.
author: Lily C.

description:
Quick food, good food. I had the bean, cheese, tomatoes, and lettuce burrito, and I had no issues. I even got to choose a spinach wrap (tho I did have to ask and wasn't offered)

The problem came with my mom's meal. She thoroughly enjoyed her enchilada, in fact she loved it. But the taco was so awful. The meat was so dry she couldn't go behind a bite.

I guess it depends on what you choose!!
author: Joseph P.

description:
Man, I really WANTED, to like this place but I just can't justify giving it more than 2 stars. 
Being a Glutard (an obligate gluten-free guy) I usually order the nachos when I want a substantial meal and I go to a Mexican place, since burritos have flour tortillas. 
The nachos at this  place were subpar at best. I ordered Carne Asada and what they put on there was ground beef. Not the same thing. The cheese was also the nasty fake cheese sauce you get at the movie theater or something (if you eat that stuff...). It wasn't even that cheap, clocking in at $9. Maybe if you order burritos or something else on the menu or might be better but as far as I'm concerned, I won't be going back. There are too many places to get Mexican food in San Francisco,  that are just so much better.
author: Ian C.

description:
If you're hankering for some greasy Mexican grub in the Marina and the queue for a table (or even a seat at the bar!) at Tacolicious is an unattainable feat, you could do a lot worse than Los Hermanos. 

You'd think of the two eateries located directly across the street from each other, an authentic-sounding joint like Los Hermanos would trump the fare at an outpost owned by a circle of gringos called Tacolicious, but that's not nearly the case. The guacamole is just fine, but it doesn't hold a candle to the freshly prepped alternative at Tacolicious, and the rest of their menu options follows a similar suit as well. But again, when there's no chance on God's green earth of settling into a two-top anytime soon at the trendier of the two, this will suffice. 

It's a really small place, so if you've got a group of 4 or more in tow, you'll have a hard time finding a place to pony up.
author: Ruggy J.

description: By the looks you would think it is the only authentic mexican on Chestnut. I thought that once too. Sadly, it is nasty food. Our family calls it "Gross Hermanos". It would be amazing to have a great SF taqueria in the neighborhood and I wish this were it.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Excellent tacos. The nachos are meh and the chile rellano is more egg and cheese than chile.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Cheapest meal in the Marina and always super delicious..especialy on those Saturdays that you've been hanging out at Fort Mason all day and you need to power up before the evening.

The owners are friendly and get the food served up fast.  I've defintely had better hole in the wall Mexican food, but if you're looking for something cheap, filling, and quick, Los Hermanos gets the job done every time!
author: Bryan F.

description: Very conveniently located next door to Horseshoe Tavern. Burritos are good but not up to premier Mission standards. Would come back again, however being closed on Sunday's is really annoying
author: Tom F.

description: This place is pretty good. They're fast, cheap, and their hot sauce is to die for. Literally. Their burritos are amazing, but sometimes when I ask for no guacamole, they plop it on anyways. I tend to get that in most Mexican places though. I wouldn't recommend the nachos, they use that cheap nacho cheese you get at the movie theater. But on Mondays on of the workers mom brings in home made authentic tamales. Now those, I would travel around the world for.
author: Rebekah H.

description: Quick, easy place to grab a burrito and reasonably priced for being in the marina.  I always seem to order the chorizo burrito and horchata.  In my opinion their horchata is the best tasting in the marina, not watered down and just enough sweetness to quench my thirst.  Small spot, but good place to grab an go.
author: Fernando C.

description:
How could this place only get a 3.5 star?  Most of the reviewers must be jealous that they cannot afford the sitdown, overrated taco place across the street.  Or are pissed that they will not be bend over for a $10 watered down margarita.  Maybe they want there Super Burrito on the fine china.  Maybe they hate the fact that after they get lit up on Sunday afternoon that they cannot get a great inexpensive meal because this place is closed on Sunday.  The owner is a family man - that is a good thing!

Get over it - this place is a local taqueria and a damn good one!
author: Allan B.

description:
I have tried with this place a few times... I just can't recommend it. 

The food is decent, but usually overly oily. The rice and beans are uninspired, formulaic, packaged sides that add very little to the overall dish. The dishes themselves are hit or miss in terms of being hot when they arrive, and there is little worse than congealed cheese and meat that is only lukewarm in a tepid tortilla. 

In a city with such amazing Mexican food in the Mission, one would think that there is room for a stand-out place along Chestnut... sadly this is not the case. 

I wouldn't go so far as to say that you shouldn't eat here, but the two star "meh, I've experienced better" tag that Yelp uses is the right description.
author: Peter C.

description: One of the few places that offers a tostada. Perfect hangover food with all the lettuce.
author: max m.

description:
I realize that I posted a photo of the Chicken Enchilada, but the Super Chicken Burrito is my absolute favorite.  It's huge, inexpensive, and just mouth-watering.  

I've also tried the Nachos (also delicious), but I keep coming back for that Super Chicken Burrito.  (Make sure you get the one with the sauce and have them put everything on it.)

Hmmm...I don't really have much else to say other than it's a bummer that they're not open on Sunday.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Favorite burrito spot in SF!. The Mission obviously has some amazing Mexican but 
I would say this place is just as good if not better. The staff is so friendly, very fast, good prices. Our favorite is spicy chicken super burrito on a spinach tortilla. The steak is amazing too. I am looking forward to trying more things on the menu. The only down fall is that the restaurant is closed on Sundays.
author: Molly K.

description: Really friendly staff! I haven't tried their meat, but their bean, rice and cheese burritos are delicious and filling! Their hot sauce is great too!
author: Caitlin P.

description: Awesome little place, didnt think the bay area would harbor good mexican food like southern california, proved me wrong.
author: Eric J.

description: One of the worst place in sf as a native speaking.overpriced and  horrible food smh.I understand overpriced and delicious but not this place. Anyone that says this place is good don't be friends with them anymore.
author: Gabriel A.

description: I have been coming here since 1993. Still the same guy rolling up the burritos! The chicken has been consistently good all these years and still a good price for a big burrito. The red hot sauce seemed not as spicy as before but still good.
author: Rod W.

description:
Great place to get lunch at if you work or just so happen to be around the area. price is fair and the food taste decent.  Super steak burrito with 'practically everything they have to offer' =)  and super chicken quesadilla, in my opinion, are the best on the menu. Try it for yourself. 
Side note: I don't think they're open on Sundays.
author: Wayne L.

description:
I was really hoping for better. I ordered a vegetarian super wet burrito and what I received was a sour cream burrito. 

The "guacamole" is the lightest green color I've ever seen which tells me it is about 1/4 avocado 3/4 sour cream. 

The proportions are all off - not enough beans and rice, WAY too much sour cream and "guacamole."

The tortilla wasn't heated, they used their orange (cheddar?) default cheese instead of the white cheese typically found at burrito joints, and the wet sauce tasted like enchilada sauce straight out of a can.

Unless you just like a sour cream burrito - don't go here.
author: Isabelle D.

description: Delicious! Burrito was huge, chips were homemade and staff was so sweet - all at a very reasons price.
author: Aisha A.

description: The only reasonably priced option for food in the neighborhood. We probably come here once a week to grab a carne asada burrito for him and a cheese quesadilla for her.  This place has been around a while and is always consistent.  I'm a fan.
author: Sally N.

description:
i was starving after a morning meeting that was too intense for comfort.
so off to the marina for some south of the border comfort food. these hombres have been around since i worked in the hood and still pump out the big burritos at cheap prices like i remembered. the chicken and rice burrito was monsterous and truly hit the spot. saucy shredded chicken and tasty mexican rice in a flour tortilla with hot sauce.
so yummy and so  much food!
still a fan!
author: Jeff W.

description: When I originally wrote this review- my experience with "authentic" mexican food in the city was pretty limited and didn't include anywhere in the Mission.  After many years, and many other taqueria's attended, I can safely say their burritos stack up against just about any others in the city.
author: Mark P.

description: A good spot for "cheap eats" as far as the Marina is concerned, and you could get giant breakfast burritos when it's no longer breakfast time.
author: Jenn C.

description: I really like the carnitas. I keep the burrito simple. No sour cream etc... Solid burrito outside of the Mission.
author: Jane B.

description: Uhggg, thought I'd save a few bucks and score some more authentic Mexican food- avoiding tacolicious. I wanted to like this place, small, modest and real. However the pork tacos were something lacking. The meat was dry and tasteless. The super nachos were old school style nacho cheese- which actually was much more tasty then the tacos. The horchata however was very delicious. I guess if you stick to the nachos and the beans, you'll fare well. Service was quick and friendly. The prices are reasonable for a quick taco shop.
author: Naomi K.

description:
I see a lot of reviews saying that the food is bland.  That wasn't my experience.  I ordered the quesadilla suiza with steak and hot salsa - it had TONS of flavor!

I was really happy with my meal, the service, and the price.  I will definitely return!
author: Maria C.

description: Been going here off and on for over 20 years. My last visit was disappointing. My burrito just tasted like lard.
author: Patrick S.

description: The carnitas taco and burrito gave the wife and I an upset stomach, and I have an iron belly! The waitress was nice, it was quiet and the price was fine. Who cares if the pork is old or spoiled. At least we didn't get food poisoning, thank you peptones bismal. I have been to Mexico a couple times, but it only happened here!
author: Tom M.

description:
OUTSTANDING Mexican food for cheap!  I go here often because the burritos are the size of a large forearm and the guac is amazing.  A large burrito is about 8bucks and totally worth every penny. 

The service is great and speedy, everything is in big quantities and filling....I am able to split s burrito and still feel full.
author: Hillary B.

description: Delicious burritos for a very good price, considering its in the Marina. Los Hermanos is a couple of blocks away from where I live and its my go-to place for a burrito. I love their Chicken w/ Sauce meat option - very unique! The restaurant is small with a few tables, and so its ideal for a quick to-go order. The staff is nice and the place is very clean (98/100 health score).
author: Amit J.

description: OOKK...coworker and I made a pitstop after a shopping trip. I ordered a beef burrito with sour cream, guacamole, pico de gallo and hot sauce. I mistakenly thought it was going to be a small boring burrito. Instead I got a huge thing bigger than my face. It was so big it was awkward trying to eat it. It was filling and worth every penny. I'm not a burrito connoisseur but Los Hermanos hit the spot.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Wow! I finally tried this place. What a disaster. They act like it is day #1 - 2 cheese enchilada platter? How do I do that? I  think I'll microwave this here tortilla.  I had to say 4 times: "I'll have that here"  Then, when they rang it up, there it was in a to-go bag.

Also, and I have zero patience for this, the prices I was charged did NOT agree with the posted menu. And guess what? They were higher than the posted menu. This seems to be common practice in this city and I am really tired of it. The city should send around inspectors and levy giant fines when they discover this odious practice.

And to cap a truly awful meal and visit, they REFUSED to give me the goddamn menu price. Unreal.  Stay away. There are far better dining choices in this area.
author: George S.

description:
My meat loving boyfriend raved about their veggie burrito here. That says something.

Apparently they don't skimp on ingredients- in fact, he only ate 2/3 of his burrito for lunch- and it was very tasty and affordable.

Probably best for take-out.
author: Roxane W.

description:
Mi gusto mucho Los Hermanos.......

Five and a half years and nothing's changed - and that's a good thing. These guys know how to serve up a super tasty, packed burrito - and you get what you pay for - a darned good burrito. Is it the best burrito in town? No but who cares. It's big, it's bad, it's meaty (or beany) and it totally does the trick. What is really fabu is that they have tomato, whole wheat and spinach tortillas in addition to their flour option. For a small little shop, they make sure the tables are cleaned and that you're comfy if you choose to sit-n-eat versus pay-n-go.

And they couldn't be any nicer. Especially cuando tu hablas espanol.
author: Meredith R.

description:
I've been here many times and always thought the burritos were decent, but I stopped going because one of the employees intentionally overcharged me one day.  I had always ordered the same thing, and it was always nine dollars and change.  But on this one occasion, the guy rang me up and casually said, "ten".  I asked if it was ten even, and he said yes.  The next time I went in, it was nine and change, just like always.  So the guy ripped off my change -- very petty, very irritating, and dishonest.

One of the problems here is that the customer can't see the amount on the register.  It's visible only to the employee.  So my advice is:  try to lean around and check the amount before you pay, or maybe even ask for a receipt.
author: Rob M.

description: Big bomb burritos. Where else u goin to go in the marina for that? $7.39 for super burrito.
author: Teddy K.

description:
I ordered a carne asada burrito and it was pretty dry. I can't say that I was impressed by it. The cheese was put on there and hadn't melted so everything just seemed kind of thrown together. 

The horchata was 4.5 of 5 stars. It was DELICIOUS.
author: Carlos A.

description:
I love(d) this place. I first came here in highschool when my cousin Momo decided to take me here for burritos one day. I've been here twice again ever since... 

I recently came here because I was hungry, in tha Marina nd craving some Mexican food. Ordered a super steak burrito... It was ALRIGHT - - not ALL THAT like i'd get at other places. Nothing special or made me want to say, 'Wow...'. What i did realize was that i MISS having lettuce nd some other stuff in my super burritos like i did at another taqueria that i haven't been to in awhile. Gotta hit that place up again...

But back to this place, It's 'A-OK'. Tha employees are really nice nd friendly ! I also love tha paintings they have hanging on their walls. I'd recommend this place only if you're craving Mexican nd happen to be in tha Marina !
author: Michael N.

description: The best value for mexican food in the Marina. The staff is very friendly and the quality is consistent, tasty and good size portions. You can ask for hot sauce as well if you like more spicy. I've been coming here for years now and will continue to do so :) Love this neighborhood spot!
author: Katie F.

description: Good and reasonably priced food in an area where the two are not used together very often.    Will try again on my next visit to this area of SF.
author: Eric W.

description:
Got tacos? Great ones, please.

It was so unexpected, but Los Hermanos does.

With so much competition for good eats in the Marina, how do they even differentiate?

Well for starters, they skip all the fancy fuss. They go all out with succulent tender carne asada and lightly crisp, fresh, grilled fish. Each taco is generously portioned, so that even two tacos are more than enough for one person. The black beans are tasty, filling, and rest well on top of that special tortilla of theirs.

Second, prices are super affordable. One taco, fully equipped w/ generous meat, fresh salsa, & your choice of beans is less than a mere $3.

Third, service is fast, friendly, and completely easy. No waiting in a horrendous line or walking past hoards of crowds. Place your order w/ the friendly guys behind the counter and your meal is ready in five-ten minutes. It's cool because the 30 minutes we were there, there were a handful of what looked like repeat customers.

Bottom Line: Great spot for taco goodness- delicious, affordable, & fast. 

I love the no fuss concept, especially in the Marina.
author: Joy A.

description:
Wow!  A place like this in the Marina?  Awesome.

I rolled by Hermanos this afternoon after a gigantic bike ride.  I was starving, and the thought of loads of carbs and proteins got me going.  They delivered.

The decor and the menu are really, really straightforward -- this is more or less a super-cheap taco stand.  I ordered the taco and enchilada combo plate (one of the larger entrees); with a drink the tab came out just over $10.

My plate was fantastic, loads of food and I got what I paid for:  pretty good food.  The chicken was well cooked, but the meat couldn't be distinguished from the rest of the dish.  The hard taco shell was crispy and fresh (tasted like flour, and that never happens!).  Tomatoes, lettuce, and salsa were similarly fresh and well-prepared.

I'd definitely come back here for take out or a lonely sit-down meal.
author: Bill H.

description: Yes! Had a steak burrito and it was delish! It was a good size and didn't leave me wanting more! Only reason for 4 stars is because it didn't include chips.
author: Andrea A.

description: Poor excuse for a taqueria to be honest. They only offer "chicken" and "beef" as the meat options listed. The chicken I got was in some sort of red sauce that didn't really have much flavor. I ordered a burrito with this "wet" option of chicken and it came out quickly enough which was nice. The burrito was wrapped very poorly and upon opening it, just about everything fell apart. The meat wasn't anything special, the beans were too runny and the rice was tasteless. Even with the dearth of Mexican options in the Marina, I'd stay away.
author: Tom F.

description: Being 'raised' in the Central Valley, we miss our simple Mexican food!! This place has it!!! Want a great, fresh burrito? Go here!! This is our once a week meal!! Are you kidding? My hubs and I share the super burrito - $7.50 - and are very pleased! We've tried the carne asada and chicken. Ask for chicken with sauce including jalapeños. You cannot go wrong here!!
author: Barbara N.

description: I grade places based on what they are, not some unicorn standard.  This isn't gourmet.  It isn't as far as I know sustainable local whatever.  What it is is tasty, good portions, reasonably priced, very friendly service.
author: Steve S.

description:
Please note that I am specifically reviewing the Super Chicken Burrito, and that, my friends, is a 5-star burrito. CHICKEN WITH SAUCE. Very important that you get the chicken with sauce. Amazing. Orange and amazing. I regularly drive across town for this.

The chips are also really good. Appropriately greasy and salty.

If you want something healthy, go elsewhere.
author: Patty J.

description:
Matt made an attempt to come here months ago, and saw on the posted sign that they close at 9:30pm and closes on Sundays, in which it's very unusual for a taqueria to close early especially in the Marina. 

In a second attempt, Matt was here and bought a Carne-Asada Super-Burrito for lunch. The Super "Silver-Bullet", which cost $6.50 was decent and acceptable. Matt requested Black-Bean, and they put a ton of it in the heavy burrito, along with cheddar-cheese and meat, in which Matt's bowels was heavily in action throughout most of the afternoon.  This small place may not win in a battle for the best-taqueria in SF, but it is good enough for Matt and the entire Marina District.
author: Matt G.

description:
So here I am, on my lunch break, looking for a good burrito place, so I stop by Los Hermanos. "This place looks interesting and not very commercial, which must mean it's good," I thought to myself. Well, I was wrong, dead wrong. Los Hermanos is awful. I had the chicken burrito and it was the most tasteless thing I've ever tasted. Without exaggeration, the WORST burrito I've EVER had. 

Bottom line: do NOT go here.
author: Kevin D.

description:
Not the worst place I've eaten, but definitely not the best. The dining area is tiny, the food isn't as warm as you might like it to be, and worst of all to me, my burrito was slapped together with a bunch of ready made ingredients before I could even give the cashier my money. Definitely not worth the price I paid.
When I buy a beef burrito with beans, rice, and guacamole, I expect it to be warm and flavorful, but that is not what you will receive at Los Hermanos. They will instead give you a burrito that is just a little warmer than the guacamole they slapped on top. The rice will be mild and to some, maybe even flavorless, and you can bet that the beans are probably the reheated leftovers of yesterday. 
At best, it was alright, just because I was hungry.
author: Anthony M.

description: The fish burrito wasn't my favorite, but the steak is really freaking good.  Especially with pintos.
author: David P.

description: Awesome food if you're not looking for ambiance. It's simple, but clean, and the food is fantastic.  My husband has excellent taste, and he swears by it and so do I.
author: Marii S.

description:
In an area where a restaurant could probably charge $10 for a muffin because it was made from all-natural ingredients, Los Hermanos is one of the few spots I visit frequently because of its reasonable prices and good food.

I've been here on several occasions, and my favorite thing so far has been the chicken burrito with rice, shredded toppings, and hot sauce. For around $10 you can get a large-portioned burrito and drink and if you choose a side of tortilla chips. (although I wouldn't recommend the tortilla chips because they were pretty bland when I got them). The burrito itself should be more than enough to fill you up -- and if it isn't, please check the scale.

I would recommend Los Hermanos to anyone in the area who is looking for good Mexican food. There are only a few places on Chestnut that offer Mexican food, but I think Los Hermanos is the best bang-for-your-buck place in the area. The guys behind the counter are also really friendly and hard-working and get your order out super fast. So bring your appetite and hopefully your tolerance for hot sauce because if you ask for it they'll definitely give it to you.
author: Sean B.

description:
Horrible! Enough said.....

I love Mexican food. I really love hole-in-the-wall Mexican food. But Los Hermanos might be the worst hole-in-the-wall I have ever been.  Which is unfortunate because it is literally a block away, but I will never go there again.  

As other's have mentioned in their reviews, the food could not be further from authentic.  The cheese enchilada consisted of cheese rolled up in a flour tortilla, thrown into the microwave, add some lettuce and more cheese, and then drenched in enchilada sauce.   I ended up just getting a burrito with rice and beans because I was scared to try the meat here.  Making things worse, they didn't have a salsa bar, or even any salsa for that matter, just hot sauce at the tables.  

To top it off, the prices aren't even that great.  They aren't by any means expensive, but not really any good deals like other hole-in-the-walls.  The only good thing about this place was that the guys making the food were at least nice.  All in all, stay away from here.
author: Dustin P.

description:
I really want this place to have good burritos because it has that "hole in the wall vibe" - but its just not. The food is not bad, its just bland and I constantly have to cover it in hot sauce. 

Define insanity - I still go there about once a month expecting something different, but always leave disappointed. At least I'm full...
author: I D.

description: Huge piles of meat over beans on the tacos. Need I say more.
author: Ronnie D.

description: Killer Authentic Mexican food, cheap too!!!!
author: Chris H.

description:
I work nearby and I had a bad craving for Mexican food.  I was in the Mission yesterday and that might have been the better place to go but I wasn't going to drive to the Mission today.  Ugh!

I had a Super Chicken Burrito with sauce.  The sauce, I suspect, is just grease because of the weird orange look.  I'm fine with it.  It was great although my stomach disagreed.  It was mad at me for the rest of the afternoon.
author: Ashley I.

description: I walked in after softball practice to find something that would hold me over for dinner. I ordered two pork soft taco's with black beans. It was the best soft taco! I can't wait to go back and try a burrito. Great job guys!
author: Kyle G.

description: Not impressed. Went on a week night. Small dining area. Kind of dingy. We ordered the chile relleno plate with rice and refried beans, and the chile relleno/pork enchilada plate with rice and black beans. The rice was plain. The black beans were good but could've used more seasoning. The pork in the enchilada was hard, almost dry. Surprising since a lot of what was on the plate was saucy, like from the can or bottled sauce. What killed it for me was the chile relleno. The batter was way too "eggy," almost like a crepe -- and I'm not a big fan of eggs. Luckily, my husband is. We both enjoy spicy food and sauces, and requested "heat" be added to our dishes. Big miss. Even their bottled hot sauce missed the mark. Way too mild for us.
author: Mary C.

description:
Dear Los Hermanos, 

Thank you for providing Chestnut St. with a cheap dining option. If it wasn't for you, I would sadly overspend at nearby eateries and leave hungry. Now, I know you're service is super and cleanliness is evident. The food is (again) cheap and I cannot complain, but I will not rave about the taste for my burrito was quite mediocre at best. Another visit to this establishment? Sure, why not?

Thanks again, ~L
author: Lisa R.

description: I was shocked to see they did not have a 5-star rating?  This is a great hole in the wall place in the neighborhood.  The staff is super friendly and their food is fantastic.  They do a great job of getting people in and out as fast as they line up.  My favorite is the chicken super burrito made with grilled chicken.. A big burrito for only 6 bucks!
author: Joustin C.

description:
I HATE this neighborhood, and wouldn't have even considered trying a delicious SD style burrito in the Marina if I didn't have to walk my buddy's dogs.  I mean, what the eff does the Marina know about other than baby strollers and retarded twenty-something chicks that won't sleep with me?  Turns out, they know a thing or dos about SD style burritos...

Other than some of the carne asada being a touch on the chewy side, really solid SD style burrito. Which is what I'm looking for. The guac was definitely the highlight in this SD style burrito: good texture and liberal amount.  Can't believe I'm saying this given the total lack of credibility of the location, but I am My Hermano's Keeper.  Chavo (bastardo) is still in the lead of the death match that is my hunt for the Golden Egg ("Golden Egg" in this context is equal to best "SD style burrito" in SF), but not by much.
author: Paul M.

description:
I actually disliked Mexican food for awhile for some unknown reason... but i decided to give it a chance. The first time i came here, i got a beef, bean, & rice burrito. I was confused about their whole ordering setup.. i thought you just order it and they call out your order or something. But they actually make it in front of you and they ask you what beans you want, if you want salsa & hot sauce... I haven't eaten enough Mexican food to tell if it is really good or not, but judging from my tastes, the first couple of bites were pretty good. then the onion taste gets too overpowering and I kept having this sour taste in my mouth =/ The beef was a little too chewy, and i wish they put more salsa in it because it got a little dry. The second time i went, i ordered the super mini nachos because i heard it was pretty good. Now, there's super mini nachos and super mini nachos with meat. I ordered it without meat, but he still asked me what meat i wanted... and i had to pay the extra, i don't know, dollar or two... They put a layer of beans on the bottom then chips, cheese, salsa, guac, & sour cream. By the time i got home 20 minutes later, the chips weren't crunchy. It would've tasted so much better if i ate it after i got it. Like the burrito, I got tired of the taste after awhile and i ended up not finishing the whole thing. 
Price wise, i felt like it was worth my money. The burrito was around $4-5, the nachos were around $7.
author: Angela H.

description: Was pretty bad.  I suppose everything was edible but let's face it, if you are gonna be on Chestnut, it's gotta be better.  I don't go on that street to eat crap...  I go on Chestnut to eat something relatively decent.
author: Aban E.

description:
I love it!  If  there was such thing as a 1000 star then I would pick the 1000 star.
I got the Enchilada and it was so good that I ate so fast!  It is the best restaurant  in  the universe!!!!!
author: J. D.

description: I've only been here once, but their Super Chicken burrito did just fine for me. Right in the Marina, it's quick, authentic and convenient. Just don't bring a party in there (it's a little on the small side), and you should be fine.
author: Barrett I.

description:
Really disgusting nachos - with white boy nacho cheese liquid/sauce.

I'll try a burrito next time.
author: Jessica L.

description: Well... before I start this review, just be aware that when I ate the vegetarian burrito I ordered at Los Hermanos, I was completely inebriated. However, I DO still remember eating it, and I DO remember how delicious it was. If I come back sober and decide it's not as good as I thought, I will be sure to update my review. But MAN was this place delicious. They must use magic to make these because I ordered and received my burrito in 2 minutes or less. No joke. About 5 or 6 bucks for a delicious burrito? Yep. I'll be here again. And again. And again...
author: Ashley D.

description:
You say Burrito, I say Burro,

You say rice, I say no arroz,

You say wet, I say enchilada style,

"lets call the whole thing off..."

Except, Los Hermanos knows what I mean when I ask for a bean burro, no arroz, grilled and enchilada style. And they do it perfect with extra, extra hot salsa, the good runny kind.

Go figure, in the Marina and for less than six dollars.  Excelente, pazquatos!
author: Mai G.

description: Amazing burritos!  The food is always great, fresh and quick.  The staff are truly good people, and I highly recommend this place.  It's open 24 hours a day, and they still maintain high quality food and great service.  Try a burrito with shrimp and steak.  Trust me.
author: Joe S.

description: My bean and cheese burrito was edible, but that's about it. For $6.40, I got exactly a bean and (shredded cheddar) cheese burrito, atop which I requested sour cream, guacamole, and hot sauce. The base price was $5.10...I really should have read the entire menu to note that I had to order a burrito specifically with pico de gallo or lettuce.  I feel like I wasted my cash on a mediocre dinner.
author: Seghel Y.

description:
Love this place. I was surprised since its in the Marina. But really I dont even think the burritos in the Mission are that great.

Super Burrito here is awesome. Super simple and cheap menu and cool staff.
author: Greg L.

description: The place to go for cheap, quick and delicious Mexican. Extremely happy to have a place like this in the expensive marina.
author: Tyler J.

description: Anytime I'm in the area for work I stop here. It's clean , fast and the food is great. I also want to mention the guys working here are professional and very nice.
author: Jordan G.

description:
Why 5 stars?
Because it truly is the best for fast and cheap mexican in the marina. 
BURRITO SEXXX! Hot and Steamy! AAARRRRGGGGGARG. The drunker the better.
author: Dandy O.

description:
finding cheap good food in the marina is about as hard as finding a cheap good date!  everything in the marina is high maintenance or high rent, but los hermanos keeps it real.  

order the burritos.  i like the grilled chicken and my bf likes the beef.  i got the nachos last night and i wasn't a huge fan of the nacho cheese sauce, i'd rather have shredded melted cheese.

oh, and los hermanos if you are reading this...why don't you open on sundays?  i think you are losing a ton of business. you're giving up one day of weekend business.  if it's b/c you're religious than open on sundays and give a cut to your church.  i think this is a huge missed business opp.  you could also open late on fri & sat to attract all the drunk clientele @ circa and horseshoe.
author: michele k.

description: Let me preface this by saying I have just emerged from a two week food coma so my memory may be a bit spotty. Stopped in here for a Carnitas Super Burrito. What they handed me barely fit in my car. For $6.95 I ended up with a Burrito the size of lower Manhattan with all the trimmings - Guac, Sour Cream, tender Carnitas, beans, cheese. Definitely great, budget Mexican grub. Minus one star for knocking me out of circulation for two weeks.
author: Cameron B.

description:
This is a decent quickie fix to any Mexican cuisine craving.  The super burritos, albeit not authentic cuisine, hits the spot!  The taco servings are quite large, no need to order a second one.  The chips are nothing to write home about...same ol greasy morsel.  Salsa's are on the salty side instead of the usual caliente.

The prices are 2 bucks more than what you might want to pay, but hey it's the Marina, you pay because it just is!
author: Cathryn C.

description: I live nearby and really wanted yo like this place, but the burritos are foul.  Flavorless, not much meat.
author: Mike A.

description: I have tasted plenty taqueria and I have to say this place was not the best. I ordered a super carne asada burrito and I felt like I was eating an over sized Taco Bell mush burrito they was hardly any meat.
author: Ruben C.

description: Good, fresh food w/o the frills. Breakfast burritos will feed 2! So 2 can eat breakfast for $2.50/ea! Sweet deal!
author: Richard L.

description: A hidden, cheap and delicious treasure of the 94123.
author: Kate C.

description:
Best Mexican Food in SF!  Hands Down.  
Makes my mouth water.  Only downfall is they are closed on Sundays.
author: Yelp E.

description: Good place to get a very standard carne asada burrito - nothing special but when you're in the Marina and craving Mexican there's not many other places you can go. As other Yelpers have mentioned it is pretty dry. Don't skimp and get the regular - you need to super it. A burrito is not a burrito without guacamole and sour cream =)
author: Christina L.

description: You must order the "CHICKEN WITH SAUCE"  super burrito with refried beans, guac, sour cream, (pretty much everything) you can get on it. The burritos are so wet, it's like a burrito stew. Aah my god. They are soooo good. I can not emphasis how truly amazing this burrito is and they are consistently delicious. GO GET ONE! Seriously. Right now. Step away from the computer and get over to chestnut street. Your mouth and belly will thank you. I think I've said enough.
author: Cary Elizabeth L.

description: Holy guacamole, I forgot that I gave this place a one-star review last year! I just threw away a fish burrito that was, without qualification, disgusting. The fish was horrible - I can't even tell what it was, either spoiled salmon or mysterious white fish. I shared bites of it with co-workers and they too thought something was seriously off. With Tacolicious and Toma in the neighborhood, there's no reason to ever patronize this place again.
author: Cedrick A.

description: Los Hermanos is my jam. You can't beat their steak super taco for $3.50. They pile on the steak, refried beans, sour cream, guacamole and hot sauce. I'm a big guy and this mammoth sized "taco" fills me up all for 4 bucks. Cheap, quick, and delicious.
author: Nick H.

description:
Attention Marina people: THIS IS NOT MEXICAN FOOD!

If you think this is Mexican food, you're not the sharpest knife in the drawer. The elevator doesn't go all the way to the top, lights are on but nobody's home, you're not playing with a full deck, not the brightest bulb on the Christmas tree, not running on all cylinders, out to lunch,  a few beers short of a six pack, few screws loose, sharp as a bowling ball, knitting with one needle, room temperature IQ, I think I've made my point.

The only reason it gets 2 stars instead of 1 is because of the nachos, which are ok if you dont mind the fake movie theater type of cheese.

Why it sucks: Fake guacamole, no fresh avocado. Are you freaking kidding me? How dare you call yourself Mexican food when you sell fake guac. You should be muy muy ashamed of yourself my Hermano. Overpriced, the rent in that little closet can't be too expensive. Bad salsa too. All ingredients seem to be of moderate-low quality, even the tortillas.

Honestly, take the time to go to Papalote on Fulton, it's so worth it. Or better yet, stay out of Papalote and go around the corner to La Barca so you can get wasted with your crappy Mexican food you silly Marina meat head.
author: Marky M.

description:
I'M GOING TO SHIT FIRE......I can feel it.  It's coming,....soon.

There are 2 rules to eating at a taqueria,

1.  Always go to the busy place with a line out the door. It's safer due to turn. What is turn?  Turn is the fact that the place is so busy that the ingredients never have a chance to sit. They are always fresh.

2. Never eat dinner at a taqueria after 2PM. The shit has been sitting there for an hour after the lunch rush and that's more then enough time for bacteria to develop..... Which leads to the final answer if you ignore these rules.

YOU WILL SHIT FIRE.

- I had a burrito here at 7PM. I was the only one there. GODDAMN, my ass is going to burn.
author: Mark B.

description: Somewhere between meh, and ok...the 3 stars are for friendly smiles, cheap prices and fast service...the food was sort of bland.  Mexican food is my absolute favorite but I need some flavor por favor!  There is not enough of that here...I have already forgotten my meal and it has only been a couple of hours.  Like I said, kind of "meh".
author: Nilu r.

description:
I live in North Beach, the land of Italian eats, which also happens to be a land devoid of any Mexican food. 
*cry*
 I like pasta once in a while, but if you put a plate of pesto and a giant burrito in front of me, I'd drop kick the pesto, and swiftly manhandle the burrito, holding it like the Statue of Liberty's torch.

Now I know you really can't get Mission-quality burritos in the Marina, but I was visiting some friends in the hood last night, and my New York-transplant buddy was talking burritos, and as I've said in many reviews before, Mexican food is my lifeblood.

So we walk around the corner to Los Hermanos (I will forever love this name because of Arrested Development), step into the tiny 3-4 tabled space and start ordering away. I swear I've never seen a burrito made that quickly. On my next visit I'll have to bring along the trusty stopwatch to time the guy. 

Anyhoo, armed with a gaggle of burritos, we head back to the house to consume our treasures. I gotta say, these brother make a fucking great burrito. It's nothing I haven't had before, but it was solid. Often times at new burrito joints, I end up finding something unexpected in my wrap that I have to slyly spit out. This burrito was surprise-free and yummy. 
My one and only gripe was the lack of heat. I used about half a bottle of Tapatio to spice that mother up.

But over all it was convenient, tasted mmm-mmm-good, and was was in the $5 range, which makes Sammy Two Tone a happy Mexican-loving lady.
author: Sammy S.

description:
This place is probably the best taqueria in the marina/cow hollow area.  All of the other places are very yuppified or just aren't anywhere near as good...especially for the price.  

The super burrito is definitely their best item I have had.  The staff and other people seem to agree.  The carnitas and carne asada are definitely comparable to some better taquerias, but not quite as good.

The super nachos are liquid cheese overload so don't expect any real melted cheese.

This place definitely qualifies as one of the best cheap eats in the Marina.
author: Simon Y.

description: I really like this place! It doesn't quite fit with the rest of the places on Chestnut, but that's exactly why I like it. Their food is very reasonably priced, delicious, and authentic. If you are looking for a no non-sense place in the marina, check this one out!
author: Jake K.

description:
It was 2p - that odd time where a lot of places are closed from lunch and not yet open for dinner ...  Hmmmppphhhh

We craved Mexican.  We remembered Los Hermanos.  It satisfied the craving - filled us up - was good - not fantastic but good - not bad for a quick fix when your fave spot isn't open.  And if you remember, I love Mexican food!  ;)
author: Nicole Rynee B.

description:
10 Reasons why this does not Qualify as a  taqueria, much less a decent one:

1. It's not cheap (over 5 bucks for a super burrito)
2. It doesn't stay open late, even by Chestnut Street standards
3. No excessive use of fresh avocados, or guacamole. 
4. If there was a salsa bar, I do not remember it. It either does not exist or was lacking essential jalapeno and carrot combination overflow.
5. The service was efficient and their English was superb. 
6. Bad rice.
7. Once inside, I felt like I was still in the United States.
8. No line of people. Even ridiculously intoxicated ones.
9. I did not receive my beverage in a recycled coke bottle.
10. No blaring mariachi band in the background.

My advice: Go the distance to Taqueria Cancun or Pancho Villa in the Mission. Or take a road trip to San Diego.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Bad mexican food. I can hardly believe it myself! I really don't like Los Hermanos. The ingrediants are very generic, mediocre. It's like everything came straight from costco. I wouldn't be surprised if it did actually. The cheese is what stands out to me. In a bad way. 

There really isn't any good Mexican in the Marina. But Andale is better.
author: Jack O.

description:
This place has been a staple of the community supplying the only authentic burritos in the Marina area for quite some time.  The product is consistently good, they take tarjetas de credito now, and the hermanos are always amicable.

If you've ever craved a burrito on Chestnut St. then you already know this place...

Why I'm writing this is of utmost importance however; they are now making breakfast burritos!

I've only had one so far, I added steak and beans, and it was so humongous it took me three meals to finish it.  That also means that even after eating it twice, I was still willing to give it a third try to see if I could take it down.  It was really that good.

What makes this significant in my book - is that I've been pitifully searching for a decent breakfast burrito in SF, and have been left with a hole in my heart with fog blowing through it.

Over and over I have been shot down, in fact, I haven't had one worth returning for north of Santa Barbara.  Sad as it may be, nothing hits the spot in the morning like machaca; gringo I may be on the outside, I'm Mexican in the middle.

Adios.
author: Dave K.

description:
The last time I had Los Hermanos was in the early 90's.  While passing through the Marina, I thought I would go into the place that many a long day's work afterwards was my refuge.  I would go in, order, sit down, briefcase over the table, eat quickly and leave right before closing.  No dishes to wash -- it was simple.

I ordered a super Chicken burrito with black beans, rice, cheese salsa, lettuce.  With my burrito I drank the Limon Jarritos.  Upon taking a couple of bites, I remembered now that the burrito was less spicy than the other places in the City.  I didn't know of the other places back then.  This is one of the few times ever that I wish I asked for hot sauce.  But I always liked how the service was good and the place was clean.

Los Hermanos is consistent fast Mexican food.
author: Janet H.

description: Honestly stumbled upon this place by accident after realizing tacolicious didnt serve burritos .. Not only are the portions much bigger the food is amazing !!! Customer service was terrific i definitely will be coming back again .. I recommend the steak burrito soooo good !!!
author: Ryan W.

description:
If you are hungry, short on time and want a tasty Mexican meal at a good price you cannot beat Los Hermanos on Chestnut Street, off Fillmore Street  in the Marina. I think of it as a take-out place though they have a couple tables in what is basically a hole in the wall place. I usually go for the Chicken Enshalado Delux but they have all the normal fare. It has been at that location for decades serving the same food every day except Sundays.
This may not be the place for the finest Mexican food or the greatest atmosphere [it has none] but it is what it purports to be a qhick, tasty, filling Mexican meal at a cheap price. For that I give it 4 stars
author: joe g.

description:
If you're in the neighborhood and in the mood for Mexican, this is the place to go--not because it's especially fantastic, but because it's the only Mexican place in the neighborhood.  

Fortunately for me, Los Hermanos consistently serves up large portions of tasty food for pretty reasonable prices.  I'm a big fan of the Super Nachos.
author: Susie B.

description: Typical quick Taquería style food. Burrito will run you about $8 which is kinda high but typical for this part of town. If you're looking for something filling it'll do - if you have some time Taco across the street is better.
author: Greg V.

description:
Tasty, quick and cheap. 

The cheap part is a rarity for a restaurant in the Marina, and this place secedes in delivering great Mexican food quickly and inexpensively. The ambiance (if you could call it that) is cheery, but  seating is limited (3 tables), so it's more of an order & go place.
author: Jennifer K.

description: This place was a welcome change from the pricier options in the area, and I really had a craving for a taco. So we walked over from our hotel and ordered some simple and satisfying fare. The taco was very close to what I was taught to make; I don't know what your definition of "authentic" is, but chances are my my Mexican-American Mom and Nana don't care. Authentic when speaking in terms of Mexican food can mean a great many things, and chances are if you grew up with a relative from Sonora, you're going to have had a very different experience than if you grew up with a relative of Jalisco, Oaxaca or Boyle Heights. My point is, Cal-Mexican is just as "authentic" as the street tacos non-Latinos have now been taught to label as the only "real" Mexican food. Okay, rant over, but please Yelpers, curb the use of that irritating term "authentic". Other than the taco, the enchilada was really no more than a rolled quesadilla with enchilada sauce--they didn't really fry the tortilla like I would hope they would (and forget about baking it like my Nana taught me to do as canon)...but as I've said for other reviews, no one does enchiladas like they're supposed to. The rice was bland and the beans were all right; horchata was yummy. Servers were friendly and they take credit! If you're having a hankering like I was for some Mexican comfort food away from the comfort of home, take a shot with Los Hermanos. Not the best, not even close to a favorite, but it'll meet the need.
author: Brittany B.

description:
Wow! What a pleasant surprise! I was just finishing up some random errands and wasn't really looking to have a burrito in the Marina District, but I saw it and needed to try. 

I had the super burrito with carne asada. For a second I thought I was back in East LA! Well, not really, but the tastes and flavors were pretty good.  I saw that they used cheddar or some sort of yellow cheese instead of monterey cheese you'd typically see. Also, the rice and meat were seasoned, perhaps a bit more would be perfect. I  saw that the tortilla was kept in a semi-warm space instead of being flash-steamed like other places do which leave the tortilla sticky and gooey when you eat it.

I'm still baffled why they offer to put lettuce in your burrito. That still is a head-scratcher for me, but the option is there for those who like it.
