What a very nice surprise in the Marina District. I certainly would love another trip.
author: Michael M.

description:
Best Burrito  place in SF! (that i've tried thus far)!
Staff is super friendly.  I've taken the kids I nanny for there, and when they get their burritos all over the place, the people who work there are very nice about it! What more could you want?
author: Erica S.

description:
Great mexican food in the Marina. It's a bit different from the burritos you get in the Mission district, but still yummy.

The super tostada rocks!
author: PictureGirl F.

description:
Note: Tacos are amazing.  I hear the nachos are amazing also.  Don't know anything about the burritos.

This is a favorite place of mine and has been for years.  Grab yourself two a la carte tacos, TO GO, drive down the marina green (or walk) and sit by the ocean while you stuffa your face.  I eat them in under 4 minutes and get them all over myself.  This will be the ultimate boyfriend/fiancee test = to see if they can surive watching me be a complete pig.

But....seriously.  go eat their tacos.

bummer its not open on sundays.
author: Erika M.

description:
GOB from the late, lamented and brilliant "Arrested Development" spent an entire episode looking for a man named "Hermano", who was the man his Mexican girlfriend was cheating on him with.  I think this  Hermano guy might be here.  

In any event this Hermano makes some damn fine Mexican dishes, even if he did steal Marta.
author: Beau G.

description:
Los Hermanos is probably the closest mexican food place to my house, and as a result I will surely eat here in the future.  However, it isn't amazing.  

The food is good, but seems to lack something.  It is a little bland.  I had the super enchilada combo plate and it needed more flavor and more spice.  Prices are okay, but not great.
author: Paul L.

description: Great burritos and my husband loves the green enchiladas : ) The workers always have such nice big smiles on their faces!
author: Melissa G.

description:
IT'S NOT THE MISSION BUT IT WORKS IN A PINCH.

note to Nancy - how do you get ground beef in yoru burrito?  me thinks you ordered this way.  is it your first?  try chicken, or carne asada....
author: david s.

description: Yummy! Cheap eats in a pricey neighborhood :) You can't beat the burritos and guacamole with chips! If you are craving some inexpensive Mexican food head to Los Hermanos. Oh and they had great customer service too.
author: Chelsea H.

description:
I should have seen it coming.  The oxymoron was staring me right in the face: Marina Mexican food?!  Nothing about that concept *doesn't* sound like a complete train wreck.  But I was stubborn, starving, four hours into my weekend shift at Sports Basement and, people, I wanted so badly to believe.

None of the flavors popped.  The guacamole and rice were among the worst I've had.  I'll concede two stars for passable carne asada, but I don't recommend Los Hermanos unless you are stranded in the Marina and absolutely desperate for a burrito.
author: Karin H.

description:
was pleasantly surprised here by the fast friendly service, huge portions, and delicious flavors.

Close to home, cheap and will fill you up for the whole day!
author: Lauren V.

description:
friendly staff, killer guacamole, no frills

my favorite place to get a burrito, hands down.  i don't know how their entire menu is but i know what i get every time and they do it right!

this is what i order...
super chicken (red sauce), tomato tortilla, extra hot sauce
author: Sharon N.

description:
I came here yesterday knowing that a cheap part is hard to find in the Marina. Mexican should be expensive and how bad can it be. Well my $8 super burrito was pretty bad. My first and last bit was all black beans on a steak burrito with everything. Don't get me wrong, there was meat, sour cream and other stuff; it just depended on where I was biting. 

How hard was it to spread the ingredients around instead of spooning everything in different spots? The only burrito that was worst was when I went to 24th Street and Brannon and ordered a vegetarian and got a salad wrap. And my super burrito didn't even include chips.
author: M C.

description:
I ordered two tacos-- thinking one would not be enough--wrong.  Two was too much.  I needed one because I got a ton o' food.  It was delicious.  I don't hang in this land - land o' marina.  I was at Ft. Mason where other than Green's there is nothing to eat.  I had to sojourn to any area of the city where all my peeps do is work; so I am surprised no one asked for my passport.  I feel for my peeps who have to work in that hood.   I would go back to Los Hermanos when I am in this district again--hopefully not too soon.

Buen Provecho!
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
Love this place. It's a short walk from home to grab some kick-ass Mexican take-out that doesn't cost much, goes great with cervezas, and will let you skip the next two meals because you're so full. 

If you're a Mexican food snob, keep walking, we have enough of those snobs in the neighborhood already... If you think Left At Albuquerque is Mexican food, you won't like this joint. But it you want inexpensive and solid Mexican with zero presentation and big-time satisfaction value, this is the place to go.

La Barca around the corner has massive portions (and costs more), but there's something magical about getting green enchiladas from this local hole-in-the-wall family owned joint. Gotta love it. Viva Los Hermanos y Cervezas!
author: Gregg G.

description:
Here's how I like my grilled chicken super burrito: Pinto beans, rice, cheese (sometimes... if I am in a cheesy mood), salsa, cilantro, lettuce, jalapeos. 

Here's how I got my grilled chicken super burrito: Pinto beans, rice, cheese (sometimes... if I am in a cheesy mood), salsa, cilantro, lettuce, jalapeos, quickly with a smile! 

Efficiency and smiles without even asking. I'll be back! I am leaving one star off as I have to try the carnitas before I complete the aligning of the cosmos.

Update: I went there and got a chicken burrito that was just disappointing. Star dropped.
author: Scott T.

description:
The "meh" option that described 2 stars fit my opinion perfectly. The place is clean, right around the corner from my apartment, and the people are super nice. There. 2 stars.

The minus 3 are for the blannnnnnnndest Mexican food in the universe. It's like all their spices hightailed it out of there (and ended up at El T - what can I say, I'm a loyalist), and someone decided no one was going to notice and to keep cooking. Well, IIIIII noticed and that's why I won't be back. Hmmph.
author: Annie B.

description:
My husband has been going here for 20 years. Nuff said.
Oh, but I can't stop there. Here's what we get:
Chile relleno burrito = best choice for non-vegan veggie folk. It's a burrito with a relleno inside. Yuummm!
Regular burrito with rice + chicken in red sauce. It ain't fancy, but MAN, is it tasty.
That's it. That's what we get ever darn time 'cause it's so darn good. Go there and order those things. You can thank me later.
author: M. C.

description:
I live up the street.  Seems to be a popular joint, however, my experience in the Mexican arts tell me that it's just your standard issue Mexican food.

for one, you'll notice that the prices are higher than usual, probably because its in the marina.  i will say that the staff/owners are courteous, they keep the place very clean, and the menu is somewhat extensive.  if you're looking for extravagance, head the other direction.

I've only had the luxury of trying the chicken and carne asada.  and I've had a nice  glance at the food prep table.  most of the meats are already pre-cooked, so if you go in after rush hours, good luck.  think cooked meat on lukewarm metal. 

the nachos, which i have succumbed to, are only good b/c i really don't have a choice.  i will say the condiments are fresh.  the servings are generous.  but the cheese, well, it's probably cheese sauce with a twist.  it's not your typical monterey jack and cheddar top off and nuke, but more of a Velveeta pour.  think high scale 7/11.

overall, if you are in the area and craving mex, it's nice.  if you have an option, head down to the Mission for real treats.  i think any store you pop in down there will hands down beat Los Hermanos.
author: Isaac L.

description:
ahhh.. its ok. nothing fancy. The tortillas they make the burrito w/ are lightly toasted on the grill! (instead of steamed) The meat looks a lil funky when they unwrap it. This time i just got a BeanCheeseRice burrito.. they hooked it up fat.. hella cheddar cheese.. Little thing like this made my day!  
(im giving up meat for lent.. ive eatin so much cheese lately.. its good!)
author: JASON L.

description:
I do not understand the preponderance of 4 star reviews for Los Hermanos. I go here because it is the closest Mexican food place to my work next to Taco Bell and it is a good price point for lunch in the marina but really Los Hermanos is one link in the chain past Taco Bell.

Generally, it is bland and with substandard ingredients for the price. I tend to stick to the burritos and tacos (if you get the tacos without beans it is pretty much a meat and pico de gallo salad on corn tortillas, which I like) but straying away from those basics can be dangerous. Recently, I got the super nachos to mix it up. These pretty much amount to a slightly improved Nachos Bell Grande. Generic "nacho cheese" and all.

I really think Los Hermanos takes its biggest hit in the ingredients and of those the cheese is the worst. I know good cheese is expensive but when it comes to Mexican food, from any region, this is not the place to cut corners.
author: Peter F.

description:
This place is pure mexican magic. I normally go for a Carnitas burrito, hold the sour cream and have never been dissapointed.

The only negative thing I can say about the Brothers is near death experience I faced last Sunday when they were closed.
author: Lachlan B.

description: As close as ur gonna get to actual Mexican food in the Marina..you know what they say bout grungier loving Mexico food
author: Steve Q.

description:
Well, sure, you might say that I'm en easy rater. I've been called worse.

But I believe the abundance of 5-stars in my review list is due to the fact that I often Yelp before I gulp. (Okay, that was cheesy. Even for me.)

Los Hermanos is amazing. While "down and dirty" aren't often words you associate with food, somehow at  Los Hermanos it increases the appeal.

There are very few seats, but if you can score one of the 1980-McDonald-reject booths, you feel pretty darn good about yourself. And if that doesn't do it for you, just wait for the nachos or burrito to put you over the top.

If only they served margaritas. Then they'd give frou frou "mexican" Andale a serious run for their money. In fact, next time, I think I'll order an Andale 'rita to go and Los Hermanos to stay. (Wait. Did i get cheesy again?)

Oh! And I'd be remiss if I didn't give a shout out to the Arrested Development story line. "You mean el hermano is here? In the house? Can you take me to him -- el hermano?" LOVE it.
author: Josie Z.

description:
3.5 stars.

Easy place to go in and grab a burrito or quesadilla. So many other places in this neighborhood become pricey little adventures in incredibly small places. Los Hermanos doesn't try to hide the fact that it is small, cramped, has few tables, but serves really good burritos. Try the carnitas super burrito, but be sure to ask for extra hot sauce or it won't be spicy at all. Also try the quesadillas suizas with chicken. Good smoky chicken flavor and lots of yummy cheese.
author: Paul G.

description:
My yelposohpy (a poor attempt at combining yelping and philosophy) on burrito joints:

One star: I could have done better myself.
Two stars: Edible, but likely expensive and/or an oil filled mess.
Three stars: Not bad, good mix of price/product, likely wouldn't go back, but glad I went
Four stars: Tasty, usually with great service and/or no charge for extras
Five stars: Run, don't walk, to go here. Excellent service, well priced, healthy, delicious
 
Los Hermanos (surprisingly) falls into the four star bucket. Once you get past the initial concern of a menu design that looks like a carry over from the 80s/fast food, you'll discover friendly service, wheat tortillas and no charge for lettuce all comes together for a solid burrito for less than $6.
author: Jason B.

description: If you go to Los Hermanos, you need to have the CHICKEN ENCHILADAS! Best enchiladas I've ever had. Don't order anything else! I've had the burritos here, but they're nothing like the enchiladas! I've been eating here for 15 years and they never disappoint!
author: Erin M.

description:
My go-to place for a quick, inexpensive burrito.  I always order the carne asada super burrito that comes with super-delicious grilled steak, beans, loads of guac, salsa, sour cream, etc.  Also good are the nachos, taco salad and enchiladas.  The guys behind the counter are very fast with the orders and super duper friendly.

UPDATE: we've moved out of the area and have tried unsuccessfully to find a comparable neighborhood place in the Richmond.  We are always happy to come back to Los Hermanos!
author: Amy P.

description: I am Mexican and I must say this place is pretty authentic. Haven't tried any of the plates, but the tacos and burritos are AH-MAZING. Refried beans make all the difference because those are the authentic Mexican beans that my grandma makes back in Mexico. The sauce- chicken burrito with those beans give me orgasms.
author: sasha l.

description:
I've never had anything else on the menu except for the burritos, but it wasn't that bad. I'm originally from San Diego and the taste is very similar. Their salsa is ok, good flavor but not enough spice (but i don't blame them for making it bland considering all the rich whiny people over in the marina who probably can't handle it). 
It's a bit pricey (due to location), but the quantity they give you is decent. 
-Important: Customer service is fantastic. The employees are always nice and in a good mood. They know all the right questions to ask. (you'd think that'd be simple since it's just a small food place, but i'm suprised about how many places with great food have horrible service). Service is quick. 
If i was craving mexican food and i was in the marina, i would absolutely go there!
author: Mea D.

description:
Great service - the guys there are super sweet

not good for vegetarians - and not open on sunday - thats why i got rid of one star

I also rarely eat there - its more of a take out place.

I order the Super Burrito - its like 6 dollars and two meals worth & the have whole wheat tortillas!!!

love it!
author: Lauryn S.

description: Surprisingly tasty and inexpensive Mexican food in the Marina. Their burritos are consistently fresh and delicious (and huge), and the service is always fast and friendly. Suffice it to say, Los Hermanos' close proximity to my work is the reason I'm getting fat.
author: Sabrina V.

description:
This place is freekin great!  As a burrito-aholic, I love their Super Chicken Burrito. So tasty. So yummy. For smaller appetites, try the Chicken and Rice Burrito. The staff is friendly and the kitchen so clean you could eat off it. Parking is a bitch. 

Catch my full review on the Don't Call It Frisco blog: http://dontcallitfriscoblog.blogspot.com/
author: Dont Call It Frisco D.

description:
The only thing keeping me from giving this place 1 star is the firendly service.  

I've been here about 3 times now, ordering a super chicken burrito, breakfast burrito, and chicken quesadilla w/ horchata respectively.  Maybe I need to try the other meats before judging this place, but that won't happen, because I'm never going back.  

I would describe the chicken as tasting like it had been boiled in lard from its frozen state and then shredded.  Lots of dark meat...which I personally am not a fan of.  The burrito wasn't terrible, just super greasy, and I especially noticed the bad taste when I reheated it the next day (although that is never a good move no matter where the burrito is from).

The breakfast burritos are weird.  I think because I'm not used to having rice in them, but what really ruins it is the cheese.  It is definitely Kraft...and far too much of it.  Makes the burrito drip with grease.

The quesdailla made me want to vom.  I couldn't even finish half of it before tossing it.

The horchata doesn't even taste like an horchata...more like sugar water.  

Sorry guys
author: Ben W.

description: Maybe I should of gotten the refried beans instead of the black? Maybe I should of said "no rice"? Maybe I should of added sour cream? What ever it was this veggie burrito did not do the trick for me. I think it needed a little more kick, more salsa? Maybe I should of ordered the quesadilla because standing in line staring at one, it looked pretty cheesy and yummy. Next time.
author: Kelley D.

description:
Perusing the few blocks between my worksite on Francisco and this place made for most of my experience.  Slews of hot babes checking out the painter dudes in white and ostensibly heavily used Dickies would not deter their brazen and modestly honed farmers-tan-laden biceps from swinging all the way to the lone Mexican joint in the otherwise counter-Mission District facade of the Marina.  

Somewhat annoyed but hospitably, my order for two meatless super tacos was taken with good communication as to what I actually wanted to fill the double stacked soft tortillas.  Definately speak up and double check they gave you hot sauce, extra guac, whatever (walked out with no hot sauce the day prior).  The black beans and rice are very good, the gauc is okay, and the hot sauce rather tame but important to round out the flavor.  The key here is the tacos are packed fearlessly into the to-go container and seven dollars goes a long way.  

Paltry drink selection, but it is very clear that they do have Horchata.  Eating in is better avoided but possible if you must.  Well done in terms of satiation; meals provided with extreme expedience.
author: Erik O.

description:
I have given this place several chances and they have never failed to disappoint.  I know it is the only mexican restaurant in the area but it is really terrible.  

The Guac is watery and I really don't think they use any Avocadoes , the chips are stale, the burritos are too wet and the cheese never seems to melt, it clumps and frankly tastes terrible.

Since Andale (which was no doubt more expensive) closed the only option is Lefty's on Union but that is to pricey too.  

Just frustrated that there are no good mexican options in the marina/cow hollow.
author: jonathan c.

description: Bean, Cheese, Tomato and Lettuce burrito-one of the better vegetarian options on chestnut street
author: Kelle Y.

description:
I cannot go here again. I went midday during the week for a burrito and was served a cinder block of sub par produce and luke warm others. Eating it felt more like an obligation rather than my usual burrito treat. I can understand them staying in business with the steady flow of horseshoe regulars and that there is little competition in the Marina, but they can do better... I hope. 

I'll try again when I get a craving for Mexican and I'm just too lazy to hit up the Mission (although I don't think that will happen anytime soon). Mmmm, I think I might head to the Mission now. Peace!
author: Patrick C.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday evening with three other friends in search for a bare-bones place. 

I order a super burrito with beef and no guac. It was pretty good, but I would still rather have a super burrito from El Farolito  (I hope I didn't spell that wrong). 

If you're craving mexican and you're around the area, flock to Los Hermanos! The staff is also very prompt and polite. 

**Just a note: I purchased a glass bottle of soda as well - they knew I wanted it right then and there and opened it for me before I even noticed - how cool!
author: andy y.

description:
There are many many many much better Mexican restaurants in the area...

And even if there weren't then I still wouldn't pick Los Hermanos.
author: Anna V.

description:
This is probably the best taqueria-style place in the Marina.  The service is uber-friendly and it's a nice, homey spot amidst the trendy Chesnut street eateries/bars.  The other Mexican places in the area are over-priced and just don't cut it for me.  

I like the super chicken burrito, it's consistently good and I always have a third leftover for the next day's lunch.   An order of guacamole & chips are good to share with someone else.  Make sure to ask for a couple of healthy squirts of spicy sauce to make your meal more flavorful.  

If you want more authenic Mexican food, head over to the Mission area for your burrito fix.
author: T M.

description: This is my favorite quick lunch in the Marina District.  It's not the best burrito in the city, but it's good enough, and not hard on the wallet.  If you have more time, and are looking for something more gourmet, go to Tacolicious across the street.  If you want to get in and out fast, it's hard to beat this place.
author: Peter G.

description: solid, no-thrills mexican food.  refreshing find for the marina.  fresh, quality ingredients.  large portions.
author: Derek L.

description: This is the best mexican food that I have found in this area. Mmmm I love refried beans and finally a freakin' place in the city who doesn't make them organic, or fancy, This is the real deal.
author: Lindsey N.

description: Consistently tasty, fast service, big portions, good prices. Sounds mediocre but it's more than I can say for other places in the Marina.
author: Kari L.

description:
Who knew there could be decent Mexican food in the Marina? Not only is Los Hermanos authentic, delicious, unhealthy and wonderful, but it is has managed to get even the most health-conscience people in the Marina lining up outside. You can tell they never expected to be so popular, so the place is REALLY small. We've eaten in the dining room once but the traffic in and out of the place was slightly annoying. It's much better as a takeout spot. 

What i recommend: the super tacos are pretty good, except the sour cream and guacamole are a little watery, making the taco difficult to eat. Also, if you ge tthe super chicken or beef (chicken or beef with sauce) the taco is nearly impossible to keep in form. 

The "mini super nachos with meat" are tasty too. They put a layer of beans, then chips, nacho cheese, meat, salsa, sour cream and guac. It's perhaps the best thing there. 

My bf gets the breakfast burrito with carnitas and swears by it! One thing I would stear clear of is the quesadillas. While they are delicious, they have WAY to much cheese on them.
author: Sarah I.

description: Love their burritos. They are really good and it's authentic style. You just gotta make sure to get the grilled meat, not the mystery meat. And they have wheat tortillas too which is rare for an authentic Mexican spot. Sucks that they are closed Sundays.
author: Alex F.

description: The burritos here are far too wet. You could literally eat one through a boba straw and that shit ain't right. But if you find yourself in the Marina and you've got a burrito Jones you really don't have much in the way of options.
author: Josua P.

description: Great, authentic place to grab a quick, cheap burrito...and if you don't load it up with all kinds of junk (e.g. sour cream), they can definitely be pretty healthy.  Just a note: as others have mentioned, they are closed on Sundays...so if you are in the area and you are really hungry (the burritos are huge) stop by this place.  I've also tried the quesadillas, which are good but slightly greasy.
author: Venu B.

description: Hi, my name is Heather and I'm a nacho-aholic, and Los Hermanos is my favorite place to go for a fix. Cheese sauce as opposed to melted cheese is crucial, and Los Hermanos layers it on liberally along with whole black beans, homemade salsa and guac and special spicy sauce. Their chips are a little too thick for nacho purposes, but that's a negligible offense considering that Los Hermanos is the only decent taqueria in the Cow Hollow/Marina area (you heard that right, La Canasta).
author: Heather F.
Nancy P.

description: I have been here three times and it has never been good so I am officially done with it.  The staff is very friendly though but I just cant stand the food.  It just is not good in my opinion.  My burriot is just very ordinary and does not have alot of taste to it.  Do not ever get Chips and Salsa here.  The chips were so stale it is ridiculous.  Anyways it is too bad that the food is no good becasue the people seem to be very nice.
author: Harry E.

description: Los Hermanos has been my favorite burrito joint since I went to Marina Middle school across the street.  All these years, my order has been exactly the same - regular chicken and rice burrito. The chicken is juicy and flavorful and the rice is fluffy.  An extra dash of hot sauce on each bite, tops it all off.  I was really sad when they decided to close on Sundays.
author: Chanelle W.

description: I have been going to LH for 10 years...same friendly and efficient owners running the place, and the SUPER CHICKEN burrito is second to none.  They sauce that they cook the meat in is what makes it and gives it a great taste...I live near Gordo and like it but, rate LH a burrito above
author: James H.

description: Love this place. Only complaint is that they are not open on Sunday's. Super nice workers and very reasonable prices.
author: K C.

description: Carnitas with extra hot sause please.  Bring it next door, watch the game at the shoe, it is just about the perfect after a long fing day dinner.
author: michael h.

description:
Great food, cheap. You will not be dissapointed.

Get the chicken enchillada combo. ($6) Savory creamy enchillada sauce. Lightning quick food preparation. Clean operation. Great cheap option for food in area if youve been walking around and want an alternative to some yuppie priced meals in the area...Small dining area, if have one or two friends with you, or eating alone..then feasible to eat there, else use for pick up...
author: S S.

description: if I could give this place negative stars I would. Absolutely horrible Mexican food..if you can even call it that. Los Hermanos is located in a prime location on Chestnut Street. It is surrounded by great stores and restaurant  so you would assume this place would have great food. Well, you would be incorrect. I love a good hole in the place because I have found they usually have the best, most authentic food. I was sorely disappointed when I had lunch here. My fiancée had an enchilada which was warmed up in a microwave with sauce and cheese thrown on top. The texture of the cheese and tortilla combo was awful! I had a veggie tostada which consisted of a thin tostada covered in a mound of lettuce, cheese and tomatoes.... I would have been fine with chips and salsa just so i could eat something but they didn't even have any salsa! they had hot sauce on the table...I was shocked when we paid our bill for the "food" that we ordered and saw the price. The prices were pretty high considering what we were given. On a lighter note, the men working there were very nice but not nice enough for me to ever go back there again. If you want good mexican good, I would plan on going somewhere else besides los hermanos.
author: Whitney S.

description: I see a lot of bad reviews and a lot of people talk crap but I went in the other night and was very surprised. I ordered  carne and carnitas tacos.  they put a little bit of beans on them, stacked them to the ceiling with meat, sprinkled cilantro and onions then put hot sauce on it.  PERFECT! I dont think i would go with much else but try it for yourself.
author: Bryan M.

description: Looking for a nice, big burrito in the Marina?  Los Hermanos is your place.  They serve up some very large burritos with your choice of carne asada or chicken.  I've heard some people thought it a little bland, but it depends on what you're looking for.  My girlfriend absolutely loves this place, but she's not a big fan of things that are really spicy.  Personally, I think it's just fine for what it is, a low-cost, take-out burrito joint.
author: Michael F.

description: I love this place. I have been going there at least once a month for the past 3 years and it is always consistently good. The guys that work there are always so nice to me and smiley. I love the customer service and they always remember that I like extra hot sauce!!
author: Kristin K.

description:
I have tried this place two times because I believe I can't make a judgement after one visit.  My visits were spaced about 2 weeks apart.

The people who work there are really nice.  It's too bad their food isn't good.  I'm sure it satisfies certain palates, but it lacks flavor, beans were runny both visits and meat is rubbery and lacks flavor.

Honestly, it doesn't surprise me that in the marina you just can't find a decent taqueria.
author: Tomas V.

description: I came here for the begiinning of my cousin's bachelorette party and we had a good time.  We order the mile high margarita which my cousin enjoyed.  I got some sort of fajita which was not memorable though.
author: Jennifer D.

description: So good.  Nice guys too.  I think they might be laughing at me in Spanish though.  I don't care, the burritos are awesome.  Forgot that I already reviewed this place.
author: Greg S.

description: Okay, let me start off that I lived in Southern California my entire life before moving here and I was really excited about going here just cause I just really craving some carne asada and the reviews were fairly decent.  I lowered my expectations a bit just in case and I really didn't enjoy the food.  The flavors were really lacking.  The tortillas used did not taste fresh.  The carne asada was lacking in flavor.  There was a lot of salsa which I felt was a bit bland.  Overall is was just lacking that kick I was used it.  It didn't hit the spot and I was just bummed out.  I don't recommend it if you're used to Mexcian food from Los Angeles and San Diego (especially if you're used to San Diego Mexican food).
author: Rose T.

description: Mexican food I can rely on.  This is a good take-out spot-- only four tables inside.  I like the carnitas, carne asada and the choice of black beans, pinto or refried beans.
author: Emily C.

description: Have I reviewed this place already? I don't know. But I want to reiterate the goodness. Huge portions, super nice staff, great prices, great salsa. If you want refried beans and american cheese in your burrito, go to Taco Bell. If you want fresh stuff and yummy hot sauce, with giant jalapenos, go here.
author: Kari G.

description: Burritos are good and very large.  Kitchen is clean which is nice and service is quick.  The cheese is cheap american and as several reviews have said it appears that all ingredients are from costco.  Not that that is a bad thing just doesn't set them apart from anything.  The tacos are average and the nachos are gross.  Melted nacho cheese like you would get at the movies.  gross.
author: Eli Z.

description: I'm amazed that in the three years that I've lived in this neighborhood I've never made it to this mexican joint.  I just had a veggie burrito here, and am satisfied but not overly stuffed.  Black beans, pico de gallo, cheese, lettuce and guacamole.  There would have been sour cream too, but I am not a fan.  There were WAY too many black beans in the burrito, so I scooped some out with a fork.  I think my dinner cost about $6, which in the Marina is way cheap.  Overall, I think I liked this better than La Canasta which is around the corner from my house.  It's worth walking the extra couple blocks, except maybe if it's raining.
author: Lindsay B.

description: So I didn't read the reviews before going..so we didn't get a burrito.  We got the 2 green enchilada's combo plate and the mini super nachos w/o meat.  Skip the nachos next time, the chips are really dense but the whole thing is too salty and too saucy for me.  The green enchiladas were delicious! The chicken was so tender and the corn tortillas were great.  I'll have to update my review next time when I try a burrito.  Easily one of the cheapest and tastiest places to eat in the Marina.
author: Emiko M.

description: Mmm the tacos are pretty worthy too - and HUGE! So.. yeah... would be nice if they had grilled veggies for the herbivores but who does, really. other than El Castillito on Church St. But otherwise - great selection, impressive salsa/sauce, and, I repeat, HUGE portions. Not bad, for the location :)
author: Anika K.

description: For some reason the last couple of burritos I've had have been not so good.  I still rate it high for all the times they hit the right spot in the past.  The spicy sauce and cheese is what makes this burrito for me.
author: Max C.

description: I love getting the bean, cheese (jack and cheddar)& lettuce burrito, with extra sauce, and wet is the secret, if you like sauce, with more cheese on top!!! Beware the large soda. Ginormous! They are also so nice here! the little guy thats always there has the sweetest smile.
author: Amanda P.

description: If I gain any more weight over the next month of the volleyball season, I'm blaming it all on Los Hermanos.  The traditional post game meal consisting of super nachos and quesadillas was delicious the first couple of weeks, but it really starts to lose it's appeal after 5 weeks in a row.  They guys behind the counter are super friendly and speedy with the service. I say come here if you're already 5-6 beers deep.  The food is scrumptious.  I can't attest to the taste quality when sober...sorry.
author: Andrew C.

description: This place was a good option for Mexico food when I lived in the Marina... well, the only option :)  It has good burritos. The tacos are ok along with the rest of the menu.
author: Bernard M.

description: Definitely a take-out place, but the food isn't bad and the line goes pretty fast even when it's busy. When I worked nearby I used to always get the enchillada meal with refried beans and rice. God it was unhealthy, but so damn good.
author: Jen Y.

description: The Super burritos are "Super" indeed :). The size is right, the price is right, when the you feel like mexican food and the mood is right - Los Hermanos is THE spot :)
author: ivan s.

description: I always go with the Super chicken or beef burritos with wheat tortilla , black beans, and everything on it!  These burritos are huge and always hits the spot in satisfaction.
author: Lester S.

description: On the drive over, my boyfriend and I were singing the praises of fa-nacho cheese and how anyone who doesn't like it is simply un-American.  But, you know, having it on your nachos from a small Mexican place that appeared to be authentic is simply un-Californian.  I got the mini nachos with carne asada and was horrified by the guacamole which looks and tastes suspiciously like the supermarket brand dip stuff that is called guacamole but its only resemblance to such is that it is green.  He got a burrito which wasn't well-wrapped and in his words "fluffy."  I doubt we'll be back.
author: Nicole A.

description: I'll just say this: they'd survive just fine even if they were in the Mission. They do what you'd expect: crank out low-cost, no-frills tacos, burritos, and enchiladas. And while you're there you can forget for a few minutes that you are actually in the heart of the Marina. I work nearby and eat there once or twice a week. No complaints.
author: Michael H.

description: Los Hermanos is my go-to spot for quick, cheap, and tasty Mexican food in the Marina.  My favorites are the quesadilla with chicken or steak, or the tacos.  This won't be the best Mexican you've ever had, but very good to grab a quick bite.  The owners are als very friendly, know me by name, and have memorized my order.  Feels like a friendly neighborhood place.
author: Brian R.

description: Hands down the best burrito I have ever had. I used to live in the marina and my hubby and I would go 1x/wk.  Now I live in Cole Valley and only dream of my Los Hermanos burritos.  This is definitely not a fancy place...down and dirty mexican. big fat, heavy, soupy burrito goodness!
author: Natasha L.

description: "The Brothers" are the best! Super burrito carne asada with refried beans and hot sauce. NOTHING is better!
author: HowieHardcor e.

description: I know this place is getting some not-so-good reviews for their Mexican food, but if you go strictly for their burritos,  you WON'T be disappointed.  Here's why this place is rad:  First of all, the kitchen is immaculate and I like being able to watch my food being made in a spotless kitchen.  Second, the same family has been working there everytime I've gone there since I moved to SF in 2000.  But the clutch thing for me is that they have whole wheat tortillas and refried beans.  Refried beans are actually really hard to find!  They're either black beans or pinto beans everywhere!  Once in awhile, I'll order my burrito "wet" and they'll drench my burrito in enchilada sauce and cheese.  Dude!  So good.  Oh, and try their homemade hot sauce.  It is fab-u-lous.
author: Jacquie M.

description: Los Hermanos is okay.  Let's face it--the best taquerias are in the Mission so if you want the best, go to the Mission.  Somebody said something about this place being one step above Taco Bell which is ridiculous.  These guys make okay food.  It's not the best Mexican food you ever had and it isn't the worse.  As for the prices, they've gone up and aren't as cheap as they used to be but for the neigborhood, they're within reason.  Just use them for takeout.  Who knows, maybe someday somebody will have the good sense to put a killer Mexican restaurant in the Marina again.  Until then, it's Los Hermanos, amigos.
author: Rabbit B.

description: Alright, sorry I'm about to be harsh, but this was the worst Mexican food I've had in sf.  The carne asada in my super burrito was especially chewy, the beans and guac tasted like they had been freshly squeezed from a bag, and there were about eleventy billion temperatures going on.  The service was pretty good, I guess they have that going for them.  It's the only Mexican food in the Marina, so I suppose you've got no choice sometimes.  Maybe next time I'm drunk down there I'll try their tacos...
author: David B.

description: I'm torn on this place - I feel like it has the potential to be decent and cheap pseudo-mexican food - however, it just doesn't get there.  They have nothing of interest when it comes to ingredients - just because it is red and slightly chunky it is not necessarily salsa.   Only thing that I have found of value on the menu is the bean and cheese burrito - for under $4 can't complain.  Also, one additional star for being close to the apartment.
author: Kathleen R.

description:
For a quick, cheap take out meal in the Marina, Los Hermanos can't be beat. The customer service is really friendly. I judge a Mexican restaurant by the chile rellenos. They're fresh and delicious, not a blimp of batter.
The hot sauce could be hotter, but otherwise for the price the food is a great deal.
author: Hummingbird B.

description: The service and the food is pretty good. I always get the Chicken enchilada and it's always good.
author: Henry C.

description: This is my favorite burrito shop within 3 blocks of my house. Descent sized burrito for under $8. The annoying this is they do not take credit cards for orders under $8! Also, they do get a bit sloppy which I am fine with. The only problem is that when things get wet the burrito gets mixed with wax paper at the bottom of the tray. Some unintended fiber I suppose.
author: Nitin G.

description: Great burritos!  Still would rate them second to Gordo, but a solid burrito nonetheless.  You can't go wrong with the super chicken...
author: Eric S.

description: Possibly the best (the only?) taqueria in the marina district? I visit this place often for lunch and early dinner since it's close to my office. The service is top notch and so is the food. If I had to complain about something, it'd be their selection of cheese. nothing special about it, but it's not bad either. I highly recommend this place as this was the first Yelp entry.... I actually signed up for Yelp to write a review on this place. mmmmmmm.
author: Benjamin K.

description: It was ok. We had a veg burrito and green enchiladas. Probably wouldn't go back.
author: bhavna p.

description:
solid grub.  dirt cheap.  good burritos any way you like 'em.  you basically build your own, so if you don't like it, it's your fault.  
i recommend the pollo supreme burrito.  add lots of jalapenos and get black or refried beans but no rice (which makes it filling and bland).   if you like cheese, the quesasillas are damn tasty.  don't be a dope by going to a  mexican restaurant and order freeking nachos.  duh.
author: G. H.

description:
whether it be 12noon for lunch or an early dinner @ 4pm or better yet, just simply having that craving of something quick and easy @ 9pm, i'd probably walk down the street, and most likely, holla at los hermanos and yell out "arriba, arriba, arriba, andale, andale, ole, ole, ole, andale" w/speedy gonzales.=]

of course i came with the no expectations because we ALL know that messican food is the bestest in sd and la ... 

but ... 

SURPRISINGLY ... it was pretty darn good, i wonder if it's because flo rida & i had such "low, low, low, low" expecations ... [fyi, i have not lost my mind, nor did i lose my LA taste buds]

cough cough* $5-6 for a damn *cough* burrito? no way jose! but given that *cough* we are in the *cough cough* mar *cough ~ina... but if you want my HONEST HONEST opinion, it's not worth it... it just ain't but if i was SO hungry that i could scarve down 5 servings and was super lazy to cook something, *snorts*, then i'd probably make a trip.

the guys are great, friendly & courteous! don't ferget to ask for those yummy jalapenos!!

TIP: closed sundays, but i have to give it to them .. opened m-sat 11am-930pm.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I ordered a burrito here and it was huge! It was enough to fill me up. It tasted good, better than Taco Bell a block away. The only problem I had was the communication. I couldn't understand the person very well and I guess he couldn't understand me. Took about 5 minutes to relate my order over to him. But overall, the food is nice!
author: Tony L.

description: I feel bad about giving the big thumbs down to a neighborhood restaurant, but the burritos here are not good--at all. I've been spoiled because I grew up on the Peninsula where there are great tacquerias everywhere. So I tried really, really hard to like this place because I was dying to find a good burrito place in the City. To quote U2, I still haven't found what I've been looking for. The grilled chicken was too salty (and I love salt, but this was disgustingly salty) and the marinated chicken with red sauce didn't look appetizing at all. Everything else, like the rice, the wrap, etc was just mediocre. My search continues for a good burrito...
author: Mama L.

description: pretty bad mexican food. their menu reads like...confusion. you have no idea what is in the burrito...don't do it.
author: selma s.

description: This place sucks. go to el farolito. The nachos were similar to taco bell and the veggie burrito was a miss. The border is way too close for then to have any excuse for this horrible "food".
author: David T.

description: I don't know if it's genuine Mexican but it's delicious, filling and reasonably priced.  The staff is friendly and efficient and you will be in and out in no time.  I must say though, it's almost comical how I can go in and give a complete, coherent order (super chicken burrito, refried beans, no guac) - and by the time they have warmed up the burrito wrapper and are starting to make the burrito, they have forgotten EVERYTHING I said.  First question I get is "what kind of beans?"  "Um, the kind I told you I wanted - 30 seconds ago?"  But, I just go with the flow and repeat myself. No biggie.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
For all of you who gave poor ratings on this restaurant, you better go
back to Taco Bell which is apparently what you are used to.
This little restaurant has been there probably since the 80's - was
called Miquel's before - the new owners have kept the same recipes.
Many so called Yuppie mexican food/take out types have come and
gone pretty fast - and this restaurant has endured.  NOW WHY WOULD THAT BE??  
The burritos are great, and you can tell them what you want more of
or less of - if you want it hot, they will add more hot sauce! The
burritos are huge and more than filling. The place is clean and
the food is always kept warm at the right temperature, so there
is no need to worry about bacteria. They are always makinf new
batches of food - I have been coming to this restaurant since opened,
and have never become sick. I really don't know where any of the
reviewers are coming from.  The rest of the food is good too, not
just the burritos, It is basically a take-out place, so don't expect a
fancy place. The help is very friendly and cooperative and the service
is very fast. The place seems to be pretty clean,
author: Girly Foodie F.

description: I was going to give Los Hermanos 2 stars for the subpar steak burrito with zero flavor, but the pitiful service knocked them down another notch. My boyfriend ordered and paid for a Coke. He doesn't like ice in his Coke, but apparently told them a second too late to hold the ice. The owner had already started pouring the fountain drink and refused to dump out the ice and give him an ice-free beverage. Nor would he refund the $1.50 for the Coke. I understand if he had opened a can of soda this would be different, but fountain drinks are so cheap and there is no excuse to lose potential customers over the measly few cents it would've cost him to repour the drink. Pathetic.
author: Cher E.

description: I've only eaten at Los Hermanos a few times, but when I have it's been a overall pretty good experience.  The burritos are great there....nothing compared to something you could find in the Mission, but probably some of the best in the Marina.  Los Hermanos is more of a whole in the wall mexican place then a "whitenized" version like Rubios is (if you could call that mexican food), which is another reason I like it so much....they haven't conformed to the normal Marina restaurant ways.
author: Isaac W.

description: Place is great.  Does anyone know why they don't have a breafast burrito?   Would give 5 stars if they had a breakfast burrito.
author: scott g.

description: Doesn't come close to my all time favorite place "Baja Sonora" in Long Beach, CA.  That said, bravo, loved the food.  Had a super chicken burrito and mom had the taco / enchilada plate.  Large portions, had left-overs for lunch the next day.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Cheryl D.

description: moderately cheap, friendly staff and huge beverages. the only downside i see is that i think their guac is made with sour cream (so not necessary). other than that, decent way to spend a lunch break. bonus points for their friendly, always smiling staff.
author: p c.
